Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Why join our team?

HyLife is a global leader in food processing. Our vision is to be the best food company in the world. Our mission is to take care of our employees, communities, animals, and customers. We are seeking passionate individuals who share our values and are eager to advocate for our mission. The exciting career opportunity of Sr. Data Analyst awaits you in the vibrant community of Steinbach.




What we can offer you:

Competitive Wage
Vacation in the first year
Benefits package ‚Äì dental coverage, vision care, extended health care, & more!
Secure, stable, and permanent full-time employment
Employee Referral program ‚Äì Minimum of $500!
Free parking
Company events
And more!!!!




Your days will include:

Planning, implementing, maintaining, and supporting HyLife‚Äôs data warehouse and reporting/analytical tools.
Aligning data services with current and future business requirements.
Mentoring and developing IS Data Analysts.
Developing strategies for effective data analysis and reporting, and implementing secure data management procedures.
Identifying efficient methods to organize, store, and analyze data while maintaining strict security and confidentiality measures.
Establishing rules and procedures for data sharing with internal and external stakeholders.
Gathering and documenting business requirements for data-related projects.




To succeed in this role, you must possess:

Possessing post-secondary education in Information Services, Statistics, Data Management, or a related field.
Having 7+ years in a data or report-centric technical role.
Building, curating, and supporting data reporting sources and analytical tools extensively.
Being proficient in SQL; experience with data visualization tools, pivot tables, statistics, data warehouse design, ETL.
Demonstrating proven skills in report writing and data analytics, including designing charts, graphs, and dashboards.
Exhibiting strong leadership skills, with the ability to lead data design workshops with technical and business leaders.
Communicating, presenting, and collaborating excellently.




Quick Facts:

Culturally diverse ‚Äì employ people from all over the world
Fully integrated facility ‚ÄìFeed Mills, Barns, Transportation, and Production Plant
2500+ employees worldwide
We Care about our employees, communities, customers, animals, and our environment




Online at http://hylife.com/careers




HyLife has an accommodation process for employees with disabilities. If you require a specific accommodation during your employment because of a disability, please contact Jobs@hylife.com. An HR representative will be in touch with you as soon as possible. Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and our accommodation policy can be forwarded upon request.

Title: Sr. Analytics & Insights Analyst
Description:
The AIR MILES Reward Program is one of Canada‚Äôs most recognized loyalty programs, with over 10 million active collector accounts, representing more than half of all Canadian households. AIR MILES collectors earn Reward Miles at more than 300 leading Canadian, global and online brands and at thousands of retail and service locations across the country. AIR MILES is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Bank of Montreal (BMO). BMO is Canada‚Äôs oldest bank and the 8th largest in North America with more than 12 million customers globally.







Position Overview:

The AIR MILES Reward Program Analytics & Insights practice is looking for a Senior Analytics & Insights Analyst to join our team. We are looking for an analytics practitioner with a blend of proficient technical skills and strong business acumen. The Senior Analyst plays a key role in the application & execution of consumer data and analytics to support the development of customer-centric business strategies and Loyalty Marketing for our clients







Responsibilities:

Applies subject matter expertise in customer loyalty, marketing analytics and technical aptitude across the AMRP analytics stack
Contribute to all phases of campaign management (ideation, planning, targeting, measurement, recommendation) with a focus in pre-analysis and post-analysis
Work collaboratively with internal and external business partners at multiple levels to understand business needs and maximize team impact
Effectively manage analytics projects independently, including clearly defining scope, objectives, targeting & measurement strategy & communication plan
Conduct timely customer analysis and campaign measurement to identify opportunities for clients to maximize the use of AIR MILES Reward Program to drive incremental sales & customer loyalty
Advanced storyteller who builds a compelling story, presents analyses and facilitates a strategic conversation with a broad set of internal & external stakeholders
Automate and make process and tool improvement suggestions to drive operational efficiency
Actively contribute to the development, sharing and implementation of best practices and institutional knowledge across the department
Act as a mentor & thought leader to facilitate development of analysts in the department







Qualifications:

Minimum of 2+ years of directly related work experience in analytics, customer loyalty, marketing, retail, financial / insurance (2-4 years preferred range)
Problem solving skills coupled with the ‚Äúcan do‚Äù attitude
Hands-on proficient experience with SQL, Python, and Tableau an asset
Knowledge in direct marketing, campaign management, experimental design, customer analytics, CRM, segmentation, modeling
Retail and merchandising industry knowledge a definite advantage
A strategic/analytical thinker who can link assigned tasks to the bigger picture
Strong organizational, time management and communication skills (verbal and written)

Title: Admin and Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Aventas is a sales and marketing company located in Etobicoke, ON. Our mission is to help brands unleash their unique point of view and share it with the world in a way that builds lasting relationships with customers. We believe that building relationships is the most effective marketing strategy, and we strive to stay ahead of the constantly changing marketing landscape.




The ideal candidate will be someone who is a motivated self-starter, who wants to grow their career in data/administration.




Role Description

This is a full-time on-site role for a Data Analyst and Admin at Aventas. The Data Analyst and Admin will be responsible for conducting data analysis, implementing statistical models, and communicating insights to the team. They will also be responsible for data modeling and providing administrative support to the team.




20$/Hour during 90 day probationary period
$45k Salary + Bonuses after probationary period
Quarterly incentives
Opportunities to grow into management roles
Travel opportunities - if qualified (Mexico in Oct, Bahamas in Nov)




Take a look at us on our website or social media!




Responsibilities

Manage CRM
Understand and utilize different systems to construct and visualize data
Coordinating between different departments
Onboarding new hires
Data entry
Completing background checks
Administrative tasks
Assist in Payroll
Manage supplies
Assist in day-to-day operations of the office
Joining calls to learn and develop themselves in the roll




HAVE FUN while doing the above !




Desired Skills and Experience

Must be extremely organized !
Strong interpersonal skills, outstanding work ethic
impressive and professional image and demeanor
Intermediate/Advanced MS Excel skills
Participate in extra-curricular team events (company paid for)
Self-starter who is career driven




Priority will be given to candidates who have the following:

Bachelor's degree in relevant field
Customer service/sales experience
Other complimentary skills such as but not exclusive to: Event planning, Website development, HR, Recruiting.




Before applying check us out online to see what our culture is like !




www.aventasinc.ca

www.instagram.com/aventasinc




If you are an ambitious and driven individual who is willing to learn and grow with the company long term, please reply to this ad with a copy of your most recent resume.




Local candidates only. International candidates who reside out of the country will not be contacted. Please refrain from applying if you do not meet all of the mandatory qualifications. Due to a large volume of responses, only qualified candidates will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Summary:

Reporting to the E-commerce & Data Analytics Manager, the Data Analyst is responsible for the analysis of omnichannel sales, performance, and behavioral data. This position will require a technical skillset that includes daily use of SQL, DAX (Microsoft Power BI), and Python. This role requires an entrepreneurial outlook as we continue to find new ways to interpret and communicate actionable insights to key business stakeholders.

Location:

This position is a hybrid role that allows for 2 days of remote work and 3 days in the office. The office is located at 25 De Beats Street, Winnipeg, MB.

Responsibilities:


Build data visualization dashboards, tools, and infrastructure (Microsoft Power BI) that allow for the sharing of key metrics across multiple business groups.
Curate datasets from SQL databases to analyze and provide answers to a wide range of business inquiries.
Write codes to aid in data extraction and automation using APIs from internal and external sources.
Develop sales and KPI forecasts for omni-campaigns and eCommerce initiatives in collaboration with multiple departments.
Perform merchandise and product forecast analysis, transaction data analysis, seasonal merchandise demand analysis, and assist with customer lifetime value management reporting.
Support the digital marketing and eCommerce teams with actionable insights from data collected from tools that support social media, email, on-site personalization, and paid media.
Translate raw data and marketing results into easy-to-understand findings, including preparation of executive summaries and business reviews.
Aid in data validation to ensure accuracy of shared visualizations and datasets
Other duties as assigned.


Qualifications:


Post-secondary education in computer science, statistics, or equivalent work experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role
2+ years of proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
A minimum of 1-year experience working with SQL and Python
Demonstrated experience with BI Tools (MS Power BI preferred)
Experience gathering data from varying sources using APIs
Experience interpreting data and analyzing results using statistical techniques
Google Cloud Platform experience is an asset
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and creative solution-building mindset
Ability to translate data into actionable insights
Strong knowledge of and experience with databases
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to prioritize work with good time-management skills
Proficient with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, Visual Basic)
Adapts to change in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment


Bass Pro Shops & Cabela‚Äôs welcomes applications from people with disabilities.

Accommodations are available upon request during the assessment and selection process.

Benefits


Enjoy discounts on retail merchandise, our restaurants, world-class resorts and conservation attractions!
Fun work environment
Competitive wages
Excellent benefits
Unlimited career advancement opportunities
Bass Pro Cares Fund


Cabela's

  • Support the digital marketing and eCommerce teams with actionable insights from data collected from tools that support social media, email, on-site personalization, and paid media.
  • Translate raw data and marketing results into easy-to-understand findings, including preparation of executive summaries and business reviews.
  • Aid in data validation to ensure accuracy of shared visualizations and datasets
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

  • Post-secondary education in computer science, statistics, or equivalent work experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role
  • 2+ years of proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
  • A minimum of 1-year experience working with SQL and Python
  • Demonstrated experience with BI Tools (MS Power BI preferred)
  • Experience gathering data from varying sources using APIs
  • Experience interpreting data and analyzing results using statistical techniques
  • Google Cloud Platform experience is an asset
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and creative solution-building mindset
  • Ability to translate data into actionable insights
  • Strong knowledge of and experience with databases
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to prioritize work with good time-management skills
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, Visual Basic)
  • Adapts to change in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment

Bass Pro Shops & Cabela‚Äôs welcomes applications from people with disabilities.

Accommodations are available upon request during the assessment and selection process.

Benefits

  • Enjoy discounts on retail merchandise, our restaurants, world-class resorts and conservation attractions!
  • Fun work environment
  • Competitive wages
  • Excellent benefits
  • Unlimited career advancement opportunities
  • Bass Pro Cares Fund

Cabela's

Title: Data Insight and Reporting Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

HomeEquity Bank is a Schedule 1 Canadian chartered bank and the leading national provider of reverse mortgages, with a growing portfolio. As the only bank solely dedicated to serving homeowners 55 and up, we‚Äôre passionate about helping Canadian homeowners live retirement on their terms. We live that commitment every day, with a range of reverse mortgage solutions that include our flagship CHIP Reverse Mortgage‚Ñ¢ product.

Our Values, Our Passion

At HomeEquity Bank, our values drive and inspire our actions with our customers, our partners and each other.

Customer-Focused. Passionate Advocates

Courage to Act. Do the Right Thing

One Team. One Vision

Think Long-Term. Ever-Evolving

Be Exceptional. Inspire Greatness

POSITION SUMMARY: The Data Insight and Reporting Analyst will work closely with cross-functional leaders within Mortgage Operations to help support the group‚Äôs many initiatives. The successful candidate will play a critical role in developing reporting dashboards, monitoring Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and supporting leaders in making timely, data driven decisions. This role will be accountable to help build and execute Business Intelligence (BI) insights, data science models on client behavior, Operations reporting and other financial reporting in addition to business performance metrics.

MAJOR ELEMENTS OF THE ROLE:

Key accountabilities of this position include:


Provide business intelligence insights and dashboards to leaders in a timely manner
Manage executive reporting, working with leaders to develop relevant metrics and highlight accomplishments
Support Operations group in planning and reporting on, annual plan/performance, projects and initiatives. Working with various business units to align on goals and output
Develop content for executive level presentations regarding business updates, opportunities and risks
Drive business case development for key initiatives through quantitative analysis
Support project and initiative implementation and ongoing reporting and analysis
Support bank business reporting, data and analytics projects


SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

Qualifications


Completed post secondary education in Analytics, Business, Finance or equivalent
Demonstrated experience with SQL, report creation and automation (Celonis)
Advanced Excel skills
Quantitative analysis and financial modeling skills


Attributes


Detail oriented and organized
Displays integrity and concern for accuracy and ownership of processes and tasks
Strong Verbal, written and presentation skills
Natural collaborator and motivated by team success
Self-starter who will thrive in fast-paced work environment


Working Conditions Unique to Job:


Hybrid working environment


WHY WORK AT HOMEEQUITY BANK?

Great Environment

HomeEquity Bank offers a hybrid working environment supported with a culture of flexibility ‚Äì an approach that is unique to each person, and that enables both business and individual needs to be met in a mutually beneficial way.

We pride ourselves in recognizing and celebrating performance, community service, teamwork, and diversity among our employees.

A Dynamic Culture ‚Äì With People at the Centre

We believe our people make all the difference; our tireless commitment to inclusivity, professional development, and employee experience has been recognized through awards including the Greater Toronto‚Äôs Top Employers 2024,Waterstone Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures 2022-2023, the Globe and Mail's Report on Business: Canada's Top Growing Companies 2022 (third year since 2019), Canadian's Mortgage Professional (CMP) Top Mortgage Employer 2023 for the third year in a row and Achievers Top 50 Most Engaged Workplaces 2023.

Growth and Opportunities

We provide challenging and rewarding careers in a wide variety of fields. We continuously develop and train our employees through professional growth opportunities and on-the-job training. We also encourage our employees to develop professionally and personally though a series of career developing programs including our Educational Assistance Program, designed to reimburse costs related to professional learning and development.

Celebrating Great Work and People

We believe in an environment that celebrates success, knowledge, leadership, and work that is inspired by our core values. For these reasons, we have created several programs that make it easy for our employees to say ‚Äògreat job‚Äô to their colleagues and leaders.

From our Appreciate! Program to the High Five Award Program and President‚Äôs Award Program, we recognize professional achievement with a variety of rewards including points towards gift cards, merchandise, and travel experiences, as well as group RRSP/DPSP contributions and more.

Our Community Leadership Program recognizes employees who make a positive impact in their communities through volunteer work with a grant for their charity of choice. Additionally, we provide employees with one paid day off each year to volunteer at their favourite local charity.

The Perks

HomeEquity Bank offers a competitive total rewards package that includes:


Extended health and dental benefits
Employee & Family Assistance Program
Employer-Matched Group Retirement Savings Plan
Employee Share Investment Plan
Well-being initiatives including: a wellness account; virtual self-care programs and extended mental health benefits
Employee corporate discount for GoodLife Fitness


Stay in the Know

Find out what we‚Äôre up to online, and learn more about what makes HomeEquity Bank a great place to work:

LinkedIn

Youtube

Facebook

Twitter

Instagram

Title: Excel Data Entry Engineer
Description:
Job Description

We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly skilled Excel Data Entry Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be proficient in using Excel and possess a strong ability to input and manage data efficiently. This role involves working extensively with Excel formulas to ensure accurate data entry into our system. If you have a passion for data accuracy and enjoy working with spreadsheets, we encourage you to apply.

Responsibilities:


Perform daily data entry tasks using Excel and our internal system.
Utilize Excel formulas to accurately input and manipulate data.
Ensure data integrity and consistency across various platforms.
Collaborate with team members to gather and verify data.
Identify and resolve discrepancies in data entry.
Maintain organized and up-to-date records of all data entered.
Assist in developing and improving data entry processes.

Title: Staff Data Analyst, Growth
Description:
Who we are

About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies‚Äîfrom the world‚Äôs largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups‚Äîuse Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone‚Äôs reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

Our GTM (Go-To-Market) Analytics team is on the mission to maximize revenue by providing actionable insights and reporting to our partners across Sales, Marketing, and Growth. GTM Analytics is situated within the broader Data Science organization at Stripe, which is home to a diverse team of data analysts and scientists, product managers, and engineers that span their focus across sales, marketing, and product-led growth. GTM Analytics leverages sales, marketing, and product data to build and provide a wide variety of tools that are utilized across the company to drive business decisions.

What you‚Äôll do

As a senior member of the GTM Analytics team, you will lead analytical projects that shed light on our self-service business. You will increase our understanding of growth drivers and influence business outcomes by recommending solutions rooted in analyses and your deep understanding of Stripe‚Äôs users. You will partner closely with cross-functional Growth pods of product managers, marketers, engineers, and data analysts and scientists that obsess over the experience Stripe users have on their journey to become customers ‚Äì from initial signup through onboarding and retention.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with Growth stakeholders to ideate, scope, and develop data products that shed light on Stripe‚Äôs self-service business.
Influence Stripe‚Äôs Growth roadmap by proactively identifying opportunities and emerging trends in Stripe‚Äôs Growth business in ongoing forums.
Develop frameworks that allow for analysis at scale across Stripe‚Äôs self-service experience.
Build and maintain data pipelines and dashboards that provide consistent and timely data and insights.
Work with finance partners on forecasting and planning models that provide visibility into the future of Stripe‚Äôs self-service business.
Define key Growth metrics, gain consensus around their definitions, and drive adoption of their usage.



Who you are

We‚Äôre looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements


8+ years of experience in analytical roles working with large datasets
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, Sciences or a related quantitative field
Proficiency in SQL and Python
Experience building self-serve dashboards or other scalable analytical tools for partner teams
Strong knowledge of statistics
Expertise in data storytelling and visualization, using data-driven insights to deliver actionable recommendations and drive business goals
Demonstrated ability to lead and deliver on multiple projects with a high attention to detail
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills



Preferred Qualifications


Master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, Sciences or a related quantitative field and/or experience in working on data analytics in the tech field
Experience developing data-informed narratives and visualizations for external publication
Experience working with institutions that are respected by policymakers and the wider public for their economic insight
Experience building and maintaining data pipelines using a distributed data framework (e.g. Hadoop, Spark)



Hybrid work at Stripe

This role is available either in an office or a remote location (typically, 35+ miles or 56+ km from a Stripe office).

Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams.

A remote location, in most cases, is defined as being 35 miles (56 kilometers) or more from one of our offices. While you would be welcome to come into the office for team/business meetings, on-sites, meet-ups, and events, our expectation is you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location where you currently or plan to live.

Pay and benefits

The annual US base salary range for this role is $179,000 - $268,400. For sales roles, the range provided is the role‚Äôs On Target Earnings ("OTE") range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate‚Äôs experience, qualifications, and location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the US may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Additional benefits for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; 401(k) plan; medical, dental, and vision benefits; and wellness stipends.

Title: Data Analyst (Collibra)
Description:
Data Analyst (Collibra)




Summary

The Data Analyst will be responsible for leveraging Collibra, our primary data governance tool, to connect to various databases and build comprehensive data lineages. This role requires a deep understanding of data governance principles, database management, and the ability to translate complex data processes into clear, actionable insights.




Length: 6 month contract (high likelihood of extension)

Associate Vendors: We are accepting applications from candidates who are currently authorized to work in the US or Canada for any employer without sponsorship.




Role & Responsibilities

Utilize Collibra to create and maintain detailed data lineages, mapping data flow across various systems and ensuring traceability from source to destination.
Configure and optimize Collibra to meet organizational data governance needs, including setting up data policies, definitions, and stewardship workflows.
Connect Collibra with different databases and data sources, ensuring accurate integration and synchronization of data.
Collaborate with data owners and stakeholders to validate data quality, identify discrepancies, and implement corrective actions.
Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation of data governance processes and data lineage maps. Generate and present reports on data governance metrics and compliance.




Required Qualifications

Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, with a strong focus on data governance and data lineage.
Proven experience working with Collibra, including configuration, data lineage mapping, and integration with various databases.
Proficiency in SQL for querying databases, experience with data modeling, and understanding of data governance frameworks.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.




Desired Qualifications

Experience with other data governance tools or platforms.
Knowledge of data privacy regulations and compliance standards.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.




How Do I Apply?

Apply on this website or send an updated resume to recruiters@prolianceconsult.com.




Proliance Consulting provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Proliance Consulting complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfers, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Title: Data Analyst (Tabulations)
Description:
Reach3 Insights ‚Äì Data Analyst (Tabulations)

Reach3 is looking for a Data Analyst to join our Research Operations team on a full-time basis. Vancouver or Toronto are preferred locations, however, we are also open to fully remote workers in Canada. You will have the opportunity to learn from a team of technical and research experts and influence our future growth. You will actively play a supporting role working closely with Research Consultants across Reach3 and other members of the Operations team with a focus on data tabulation solutions.

This position is an excellent opportunity for someone who is looking to grow their career and experience in market research and data tabulations. You will play a supporting role in our data analytical processes and collaborate with individuals across different teams.

Here is a link to a demo video that shows Reach3 in action.

But, why us for your next career move? .

When you join Reach3, you'll get to help pioneer a new way of capturing & delivering insights, working directly with senior consultants and industry leaders who are passionate about the power of our approaches to drive business success across a variety of industries and global brands.‚ÄØWe pride ourselves on our culture that's built on trust and hard work (while still having a good time!) and leadership that invests in you, your development and career growth. Not to mention, we have a lineup of top-notch Fortune 100 clients that many could only dream of working with!

A few more reasons why you should choose Reach3:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ


We are currently a hybrid workplace, with hub offices in Toronto, Vancouver and Chicago. This position is Vancouver or Toronto based, however, we are also open to fully remote workers in Canada. We offer a Home Office Stipend, Monthly Internet Stipend and Corporate Cellphone Plan to make sure you are comfortable, connected and well set up in your space.‚ÄØ
We compensate fairly. We are committed to pay equity/fair pay practices and closing the gender salary gap.‚ÄØOur compensation package proudly includes:‚ÄØ
$65,000 - $85,000 CAD (depending on experience) & Profit Sharing Plan
Stock options‚ÄØ
RRSP plan with employer match
100% employer paid benefits plan including health and dental, paramedical and mental health services
Generous vacation, sick, personal, and mental health days


Interested? Yeah. We thought you might be.

As a Data Analyst (Tabulations) at Reach3, you will:


Produce data tables using statistical software programs with a high degree of quality and accuracy
Support our research consulting teams by providing efficient data services following established workflows and processes
Advise researchers on data analysis outputs to support a variety of survey methods and design
Perform quality assurance checks, carefully review and check the quality of data collected; troubleshoot and collaboratively work towards solutions as needed
Leverage WinCross, SPSS, Microsoft Excel and potentially other software to create data tables
Ensure proper quality control, data confidentiality and privacy protocols are implemented and followed; understand the importance of standard operating procedures as a means for minimizing errors and increasing production efficiencies
Learn about Rival Platform and other industry leading market research software platforms to support data analysis processes and workflows as required
Coordinate Operations tasks and workflows using ClickUp
Support the implementation of new technology solutions and process enhancements where necessary that improve business operations, and increase productivity and efficiency
Assist with documentation for training and our Intranet
You thrive and enjoy working in a dynamic and fast-paced environment where you move quickly between different projects and learn new technology


‚ÄØThis may be the right opportunity for you if you have:


2+ years of professional experience, preferably in marketing or public opinion research, with ability to demonstrate research data analysis ability
University or college degree or graduate certificates in Market Research, Analytics, Statistics, Economics, Social Sciences, or another related field that leverage research method for data collection / analysis
Proficient in SPSS and WinCross
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
The ability to work independently as well as part of a team
Ability to meet tight deadlines while maintaining a keen eye for detail
Accountability for your assigned goals, capable of driving projects independently
Excellent verbal and written communication to effectively and concisely communicate with key stakeholders


Apply Now!

If you think you're a good fit, please connect with us ASAP with your resume. Please note, you must be eligible to work in Canada to be considered for this role. At Reach3, we value the unique qualities and experiences that each candidate brings to the table. We believe in a personal approach to hiring and take the time to thoroughly review each resume ourselves. Rest assured, we do not use AI or automated systems to review or filter resumes. Every application is carefully reviewed by our hiring team to ensure a fair and personalized evaluation process. If you don't see yourself fully reflected in every job requirement listed on the posting above, we still encourage you to reach out and apply. HTML:
Reach3 Insights ‚Äì Data Analyst (Tabulations)

Reach3 is looking for a Data Analyst to join our Research Operations team on a full-time basis. Vancouver or Toronto are preferred locations, however, we are also open to fully remote workers in Canada. You will have the opportunity to learn from a team of technical and research experts and influence our future growth. You will actively play a supporting role working closely with Research Consultants across Reach3 and other members of the Operations team with a focus on data tabulation solutions.

This position is an excellent opportunity for someone who is looking to grow their career and experience in market research and data tabulations. You will play a supporting role in our data analytical processes and collaborate with individuals across different teams.

Here is a link to a demo video that shows Reach3 in action.

But, why us for your next career move? .

When you join Reach3, you'll get to help pioneer a new way of capturing & delivering insights, working directly with senior consultants and industry leaders who are passionate about the power of our approaches to drive business success across a variety of industries and global brands.‚ÄØWe pride ourselves on our culture that's built on trust and hard work (while still having a good time!) and leadership that invests in you, your development and career growth. Not to mention, we have a lineup of top-notch Fortune 100 clients that many could only dream of working with!

A few more reasons why you should choose Reach3:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

  • We are currently a hybrid workplace, with hub offices in Toronto, Vancouver and Chicago. This position is Vancouver or Toronto based, however, we are also open to fully remote workers in Canada. We offer a Home Office Stipend, Monthly Internet Stipend and Corporate Cellphone Plan to make sure you are comfortable, connected and well set up in your space.‚ÄØ
  • We compensate fairly. We are committed to pay equity/fair pay practices and closing the gender salary gap.‚ÄØOur compensation package proudly includes:‚ÄØ
  • $65,000 - $85,000 CAD (depending on experience) & Profit Sharing Plan
  • Stock options‚ÄØ
  • RRSP plan with employer match
  • 100% employer paid benefits plan including health and dental, paramedical and mental health services
  • Generous vacation, sick, personal, and mental health days

Interested? Yeah. We thought you might be.

As a Data Analyst (Tabulations) at Reach3, you will:

  • Produce data tables using statistical software programs with a high degree of quality and accuracy
  • Support our research consulting teams by providing efficient data services following established workflows and processes
  • Advise researchers on data analysis outputs to support a variety of survey methods and design
  • Perform quality assurance checks, carefully review and check the quality of data collected; troubleshoot and collaboratively work towards solutions as needed
  • Leverage WinCross, SPSS, Microsoft Excel and potentially other software to create data tables
  • Ensure proper quality control, data confidentiality and privacy protocols are implemented and followed; understand the importance of standard operating procedures as a means for minimizing errors and increasing production efficiencies
  • Learn about Rival Platform and other industry leading market research software platforms to support data analysis processes and workflows as required
  • Coordinate Operations tasks and workflows using ClickUp
  • Support the implementation of new technology solutions and process enhancements where necessary that improve business operations, and increase productivity and efficiency
  • Assist with documentation for training and our Intranet
  • You thrive and enjoy working in a dynamic and fast-paced environment where you move quickly between different projects and learn new technology

‚ÄØThis may be the right opportunity for you if you have:

  • 2+ years of professional experience, preferably in marketing or public opinion research, with ability to demonstrate research data analysis ability
  • University or college degree or graduate certificates in Market Research, Analytics, Statistics, Economics, Social Sciences, or another related field that leverage research method for data collection / analysis
  • Proficient in SPSS and WinCross
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
  • The ability to work independently as well as part of a team
  • Ability to meet tight deadlines while maintaining a keen eye for detail
  • Accountability for your assigned goals, capable of driving projects independently
  • Excellent verbal and written communication to effectively and concisely communicate with key stakeholders

Apply Now!

If you think you're a good fit, please connect with us ASAP with your resume. Please note, you must be eligible to work in Canada to be considered for this role. At Reach3, we value the unique qualities and experiences that each candidate brings to the table. We believe in a personal approach to hiring and take the time to thoroughly review each resume ourselves. Rest assured, we do not use AI or automated systems to review or filter resumes. Every application is carefully reviewed by our hiring team to ensure a fair and personalized evaluation process. If you don't see yourself fully reflected in every job requirement listed on the posting above, we still encourage you to reach out and apply. Research has shown that individuals in underrepresented groups often only apply when they feel 100% qualified. We are committed to creating a more equitable,‚ÄØinclusive,‚ÄØand diverse company and we strongly encourage applicants of all genders, ages, ethnicities, cultures, abilities, sexual orientations, and life experiences to apply.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Covet Fashion is seeking an inquisitive and experienced Data Analyst to join our Product Management team. Reporting to the Director of Product, you will work with partners to understand player engagement, session behaviors, game usage and spending habits, and to identify product growth opportunities. You will use your skills to provide data-driven solutions to complex problems, translate qualitative/quantitative data into insights, and create recommendations to steer the product development and live operational roadmaps.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with product, design, and engineering to deliver insights into user behavior and to guide product decisions.
Help design, implement and report on A/B tests aimed at enhancing the user experience, utilizing statistical methods to draw meaningful conclusions.
Analyze player segments and behavior to support tailored content strategies.
Perform advanced statistical analyses to identify trends, patterns, and provide actionable insights.
Develop dashboards and self-serve tools to communicate findings and performance metrics to our partners and encourage the use of data in product decisions.
Communicate results and findings throughout the organization to all levels of leadership.


Requirements


A bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, Analytics, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in an analytics role performing quantitative analysis with big data to help guide decisions.
Experience in SQL and ability to extract data from large data sources with differing structures.
Experience with data visualization software (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Looker).
Passion for mobile lifestyle gaming is a plus.


If you are passionate about mobile gaming and possess the skills and expertise to drive the success of Covet Fashion at Electronic Arts, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Ceci ne s'applique pas au Qu√©bec.

Compensation And Benefits

The base salary ranges listed below are for the defined geographic market pay zones in these locations. If you reside outside of these locations, a recruiter will advise on the range and benefits for your specific location.

EA has listed the base salary ranges it in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in the locations listed, as of the time of this posting. Pay offered will be determined based on numerous relevant business and candidate factors including, for example, education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, and business or organizational needs.

BASE SALARY RANGES


California (depending on location e.g. Los Angeles vs. Sacramento):


¬∫ $122,300 - $170,600 USD Annually


New York (depending on location e.g. Manhattan vs. Buffalo):


¬∫ $104,000 - $170,600 USD Annually


Jersey City, NJ :


¬∫ $137,300 - $170,600 USD Annually


Colorado (depending on location e.g. Denver vs. Colorado Springs):


¬∫ $111,800 - $151,800 USD Annually


Washington (depending on location e.g. Seattle vs. Spokane):


¬∫ $104,000 - $174,700 USD Annually


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria):


¬∫ $89,300 - $123,000 CAN Annually

Base salary is just one part of the overall compensation at EA. In the US, we offer a package of benefits including paid time off (3 weeks per year to start), 80 hours per year of sick time, 16 paid company holidays per year, 10 weeks paid time off to bond with baby, medical/dental/vision insurance, life insurance, disability insurance, and 401(k) to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity. For British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

Title: Game Data Analyst
Description:
Prodigy Education, a global leader in game-based learning, is on a mission to make every student in the world love learning. We believe learning should be as fun as playing a video game. This is central to our educational philosophy, because when you love what you do, you do it better. Visit www.prodigygame.com to learn more.




With Prodigy, kids practice standards-aligned skills in Math and English as they play our fun, adaptive learning games. All with teacher and parent tools to support their learning in class and at home.




As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with our Game Data team, applying your analytical skills to support the enhancement of our Math and English games. You will contribute to our understanding of game performance, user engagement, and overall business outcomes by exploring, analyzing, and visualizing data.




Your Impact

Build, transform and leverage a diverse set of game datasets in support creating visualizations and extracting insights for product stakeholders.
Develop refined data models to predict and analyze user behaviours and learning outcomes, directly influencing the development of our Math and English games
Build a deep understanding of feature performance within the game, leveraging statistical and machine learning (ML) techniques to assist product owners in enhancing our game
Conduct A/B testing and other experimental designs to create and validate hypotheses, measuring the impact of new game features
Continuously learn and apply new analytical techniques and tools relevant to data science in the gaming industry




About You

You hold a Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field
You have 1-4 years of experience in data analysis or a related field, with a focus on data modelling
You have a passion for games or product gamification
You are proficient in SQL and Python, with experience in other statistical analysis tools
You excel in problem-solving, demonstrating the ability to gather, organize, analyze, and communicate large amounts of information with precision and attention to detail
Your strong communication skills allow for effective collaboration with cross-functional teams and the presentation of findings to both technical and non-technical audiences




Bonus Points

Experience with DBT, Databricks, or similar tools.
Interest or experience in game analytics or product gamification.




Working At Prodigy

Be part of a mission-driven organization dedicated to helping every student in the world love learning! At Prodigy Education, your work positively impacts the lives of millions of students and teachers worldwide.
Join a company which empowers a Growth Mindset among its team members, so you grow as we do. You‚Äôll also work on award-winning products which harness the magic of math and power of language for students in grades 1st-8th.
We understand that a thriving team is at the core of our success. So, on top of an inspirational mission and rewarding work, our Total Rewards Program reflects our commitment to your financial, physical, and mental well-being.
It‚Äôs not just about the work though; it's about the culture. As the Toronto Star reports in a recent feature on Prodigy: "Prodigy‚Äôs secret sauce is that it sees its corporate culture as something that is built slowly from the ground up and is always evolving.‚Äù Check it out here .

Prodigy Math is used by almost one million teachers a year, and was named the most popular supplemental education platform in classrooms in the United States ! Our products have also won numerous consumer awards, including the Mom‚Äôs Choice Award, Parent and Teacher Choice Awards, and National Parenting Product Award.




Come as you are. We believe the power of our collective potential will transform education. We are building towards a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace to empower and create access and opportunity for all. We welcome applications from people from all underrepresented groups, including (but not limited to) people of any gender, age, or religion, members of the LGBTQIA2+ community, BIPOC and other underrepresented races and nationalities, people with disabilities, veterans, and anyone who may contribute to the further diversification of Prodigy Education. If you feel like you don‚Äôt have all the qualifications for this position and are willing to use your initiative to learn the rest, we‚Äôd still love for you to apply!




We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). Prodigy Education will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require accommodation, please notify us at jobs@prodigygame.com, and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Business Data Analyst [Scotiabank]
Description:
Requisition ID: 201024

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

The Team

Global Treasury Technology (GTT) provides technology support for business applications and related liquidity reporting. Its purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

The Role

GTT is searching for passionate business analyst who are continuous learners & passionate about big data systems and its analysis.

The successful candidate will have a strong passion for big data system analysis. You will work closely with business teams and cross functional engineering leaders to gather data requirements for the various big data & reporting projects within GTT.

As part of the role, you'll


Demonstrate an informed knowledge of business functions to resolve problems and capitalize on improvement opportunities.
Ensure business specifications/requirements documentation is accurately prepared and comprehensive to support sizing/development efforts and as input to various project documentation.
Develop and deliver Business Data Requirements Documents, Design Documents, Use Cases, and Process Models as required.
Participate in the development of detailed project plans, the monitoring of progress against planned objectives, the financial review, and securing consensus and co-operation from users and senior management.
Work closely across GTT technology teams during all stages of the system development life cycle and bridge the gap between business and technology sides of the solution.
Liaising between the business community and the IT organization to provide technical solutions that meet user needs.
Build relationships and communicate effectively with colleagues in Global regions.
Support production issues and handle escalations during Release cycles as needed.
Perform ad hoc project work on various GTT projects.
Participates in the support of the production and maintenance of the GTT platforms


Minimum Qualifications


Experience working across multiple teams and functions to ensure alignment.
2 years practical experience or relevant co-op experience in business analysis. Big data analysis would be an asset.
Minimum 2 years' working knowledge of databases & SQL, with ability to create and run queries independently.
Knowledge of Google Cloud such as big query or eagerness to self-learn.
Ability to adapt quickly to new processes and standards, with a strong commitment to providing exceptional customer service.
Proven ability to translate business data requirements into technical specifications and deliver working results.
Proven ability to draft test cases for functional and non-functional testing.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
A recognized undergraduate degree or diploma in business administration, computer science or related field required.
Excellent working experience of Microsoft suite of products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project).
Functional knowledge of treasury or financial domain would be an asset.


Preferred Qualifications


An understanding of the Bank's application system and software from a business/technical viewpoint is required to assess the impact of development and/or changes to the overall data processing environment).
Experience supporting treasury applications is a plus.
Experience managing projects that span change in front, middle or back-office systems and teams.
Strong Experience with big data systems is an asset.


What's in it for you?


Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Allyship - We strive to create an inclusive culture where every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are, and are embraced through bias-free practices and inclusive values across Scotiabank. We embrace diversity and provide opportunities for all employee to learn, grow & participate through our various Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) that span across diverse gender identities, ethnicity, race, age, ability & veterans.
Accessibility and Workplace Accommodations - We value the unique skills and experiences everyone brings to the Bank and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Scotiabank continues to locate, remove, and prevent barriers so that we can build a diverse and inclusive environment while meeting accessibility requirements.
Hybrid-friendly work environment will provide you with the flexibility of best of both remote and in office world, to perform at your best.
Upskilling through online courses, cross-functional development opportunities, and tuition assistance.
Competitive Rewards program including bonus, flexible vacation, personal, sick days and benefits will start on day one.
Community Engagement - no matter where you choose to work from; we offer opportunities for community engagement & belonging with our various programs such as hackathons, contests, cooking with friends, Humans of Digital and much more!


Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here . Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

  • Competitive Rewards program including bonus, flexible vacation, personal, sick days and benefits will start on day one.
  • Community Engagement - no matter where you choose to work from; we offer opportunities for community engagement & belonging with our various programs such as hackathons, contests, cooking with friends, Humans of Digital and much more!

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here . Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job#: 2036377

Job Description:

Data Analyst

Apex Systems is a global IT services provider, and our staffing practice has an opening for a Data Analyst who has a background in security and experience using Python and SQL to place at our client, a Big 5 bank.

Client: Big 5 Bank

Location: Downtown Toronto. 3 days in office

Duration of Contract/Perm: 8-month contract to begin with opportunity to extend for 12 more months

Hours/week: 37.5 hrs

Start date: July/early August 2024

Application Process: It is best to apply via the medium on which you are seeing this posting. If you encounter technical difficulties submitting your resume, please send a Word version of your resume to Ashley at [email protected]

Job Description

In this role, you will play a vital role in safeguarding our organizations information security posture by managing user identities and access controls. You will leverage your analytical skills to ensure data quality and compliance with regulations, while also collaborating with teams to implement effective access management solutions.

Responsibilities


Analyze raw data to identify trends, patterns, and potential risks related to user access.
Develop and implement data quality metrics and reporting procedures to ensure adherence to security standards.
Utilize data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Manage user identities and access controls, ensuring appropriate access based on roles and permissions.
Perform risk analysis of access requests and existing user privileges.
Participate in the development and implementation of access management policies and procedures.
Collaborate with project teams to integrate access management into new and existing infrastructure.
Assist with security incident investigations and recommend remediation strategies.
Identify opportunities for process improvement and recommend solutions to enhance efficiency.
Document processes and procedures to ensure clarity and consistency.


The Ideal Candidate:


You are a data enthusiast who enjoys uncovering insights and trends from raw data.
You are passionate about information security and take pride in maintaining a strong security posture.
You are a process-oriented individual who thrives in a collaborative environment.
You are a problem-solver who can identify and address inefficiencies.


Qualifications:


2-3 years experience with SQL scripting
2-3 years experience with Python
2-3 years experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Experience with access control, permissions, and user access analysis
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel with Macros a plus)


Nice To Have Skills


Prior experience in Banking/Finance
Experience with reporting tools (e.g., Power BI)
Knowledge of identity and access management (IAM) principles
Experience with control frameworks, compliance, and audit testing
Familiarity with infrastructure platforms (e.g., Active Directory, UNIX)
Experience with ServiceNow, Varonis, ARS/AD, or SailPoint IdentityIQ


This a great opportunity to join a Big Five Bank and continue your career in the financial domain. Be a part of a great work environment with a very well-organized team and colleagues who will help you succeed.

This is a position that impacts the bank enterprise wide with great opportunity for career growth within the bank.

If you are not a 99% match to the above and want to be considered for other opportunities at our enterprise clients, register for our Talent Network where you can receive job alerts about new opportunities that match your interests.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Engineer

Job Description

As a Data Engineer, you will be a part of the Data Analytics team.. Your role will involve measuring and capturing how customers are using features and the quality of these features. This includes identifying and addressing issues such as black screens, projection disconnections, display freezing, and diagnostics or transaction data issues.

You will be responsible for writing performance optimized queries and extracting data from dashboards to impact the decision making process.

Hard Skills


Experience with Microsoft SQL development
Cloud platform experience (Azure/GCP/AWS)
Python development experience
Back end experience with ETL
Data engineering experience


Soft Skills


Ability to handle large volumes of data
Problem-solving skills
Communication skills
Ability to interpret data and make recommendations


Job Type

This is a contract position with a duration of 12 Month(s).

Work Site

This is a hybrid position requiring some days on-site in Waterloo, Ontario and some days remote.

Work Environment

You will be part of an end-to-end data product development team, working with tools such as Jira, Github, and Test Rail. Some data will be maintained in Excel spreadsheets. Your initial project will be to develop a dashboard for internal software productivity.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
ChargeLab is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our fast-growing startup. This is a role for a highly skilled individual contributor who is passionate about data analysis and wants to make a significant impact on our operations and decision-making processes.

As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with various teams, including operations, engineering, product management, and finance, to provide actionable insights and data-driven recommendations. You will be responsible for collecting, cleaning, and analyzing data; developing predictive models; designing dashboards; ensuring data accuracy and security; and effectively communicating findings to stakeholders.

Your primary KPIs will include the precision, accuracy, and actionability of your data insights, the clarity and impact of your dashboards and reports, and stakeholder satisfaction based on the relevance and usefulness of your analyses.

Company Details

ChargeLab is the Android of EV charging. We don‚Äôt build hardware. Instead, we partner with leading manufacturers like Eaton, ABB, and Siemens to bundle their EV chargers with ChargeLab‚Äôs software. Our end customers include building owners, convenience stores, utilities, and fleets. They leverage our charging station management system (CSMS) and open APIs to manage thousands of EV chargers more efficiently.

By 2030, most new vehicles sold in North America will be EVs. ChargeLab has raised US $30 million to build the world‚Äôs best software for managing large networks of EV chargers. We currently have 65 full-time employees, including over 40 team members in engineering and product.

Hybrid work

ChargeLab has a beautiful office in Etobicoke with ample parking, subway access, free snacks/coffee, quiet meeting rooms, and company-provided lunch every Thursday. Our office also gives you direct face-to-face access to our VP of Engineering, CTO, and CEO.

Team members are encouraged to maintain a hybrid work schedule. Most of our developers come to the office for quarterly planning and bi-weekly Thursday all-hands meetings. Otherwise, team members are welcome to work from home for their daily deep work. We provide a stipend to purchase work-from-home equipment.

Twice a year, we host a 3-day onsite called ChargeFest. All remote team members fly to Toronto for this event. In-person attendance of ChargeFest is mandatory.

Key Responsibilities


Data Analysis & Interpretation:
Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets from multiple sources to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Perform statistical analysis to support business decisions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Develop predictive models and algorithms to forecast future trends and behaviors.
Partnering with the product and engineering teams to drive signals from the product to inform production decision making.
Business Intelligence:
Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide solutions that support strategic goals.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide regular updates to management.
Data Management:
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and security across all data sources.
Implement data governance best practices and standards.
Work with IT and other departments to integrate and automate data collection processes.
Analyze, recommend and implement the tooling required to meet the needs of the business, ensuring scalability and high performance.
Collaboration & Communication:
Communicate complex data findings and insights in a clear and concise manner to non-technical stakeholders.
Partner with cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making processes.
Provide training and support to team members on data tools and techniques.


Qualifications


Education & Experience:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a similar role.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data analysis and manipulation.
Experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
Strong understanding of statistical methods and data modeling.
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and tools (e.g., AWS Redshift, Google BigQuery).
Analytical Skills:
Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
Ability to translate business questions into data analysis and actionable insights.
Strong critical thinking and analytical skills.
Soft Skills:
Effective communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Preferred Qualifications:
Master‚Äôs degree in a related field.
Experience in the EV charging or renewable energy industry.
Experience with data visualization libraries
Show more

  • Collaboration & Communication:
  • Communicate complex data findings and insights in a clear and concise manner to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Partner with cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making processes.
  • Provide training and support to team members on data tools and techniques.

Qualifications

  • Education & Experience:
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field.
  • 5+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a similar role.
  • Technical Skills:
  • Proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data analysis and manipulation.
  • Experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
  • Strong understanding of statistical methods and data modeling.
  • Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and tools (e.g., AWS Redshift, Google BigQuery).
  • Analytical Skills:
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
  • Ability to translate business questions into data analysis and actionable insights.
  • Strong critical thinking and analytical skills.
  • Soft Skills:
  • Effective communication and presentation skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Strong organizational and time management skills.
  • Preferred Qualifications:
  • Master‚Äôs degree in a related field.
  • Experience in the EV charging or renewable energy industry.
  • Experience with data visualization libraries

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies‚Äîfrom the world‚Äôs largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups‚Äîuse Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone‚Äôs reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

Data Science at Stripe is a vibrant community where data analysts, data scientists and engineers learn and grow together. You will work with some of Stripe‚Äôs most fundamental and exciting data, and use that data to help drive company-wide initiatives. We have a variety of Data Analytics roles and teams across Stripe and will seek to align you to the most relevant team based on your background.

What you'll do

In this role, you will partner deeply with teams across Stripe to ensure that our users, our products, and our business have the models, data products, and insights needed to make decisions and grow responsibly. You will work closely with partners to extract insights from Stripe's rich and complex data. You will also work with leaders to translate business needs into data problems. You will build metrics, scalable data pipelines, dashboards, and reports to inform and run the business. You will deliver actionable business recommendations through analyses and data storytelling.

Who you are

We‚Äôre looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements


2-8+ years experience in Business Intelligence Engineering, Data Engineering, Data Analysis or Data Science roles, building data pipelines and analyzing large datasets to solve problems
Proficiency in SQL and Python
Strong statistical knowledge
Expertise in visualization and using data insights to make recommendations and achieve goals
Proven ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with great attention to detail
Ability to clearly communicate results and drive impact
Comfortable collaborating across functions to identify data analytics problems and execute solutions with technical rigor and data-driven insights.



Preferred Qualifications


Master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or a related technical field.
Prior experience at a growth stage internet or software company.
Experience with distributed data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark to write and debug data pipelines.
Good understanding of development processes and best practices like engineering standards, code reviews, and testing.



Hybrid work at Stripe

This role is available either in an office or a remote location (typically, 35+ miles or 56+ km from a Stripe office).

Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams.

A remote location, in most cases, is defined as being 35 miles (56 kilometers) or more from one of our offices. While you would be welcome to come into the office for team/business meetings, on-sites, meet-ups, and events, our expectation is you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location where you currently or plan to live.

Pay and benefits

The annual salary range for this role in the primary location is C$128,700 - C$221,900. This range may change if you are hired in another location. For sales roles, the range provided is the role‚Äôs On Target Earnings (‚ÄúOTE‚Äù) range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate‚Äôs experience, qualifications, and specific location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the primary location may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Specific benefits and details about what compensation is included in the salary range listed above will vary depending on the applicant‚Äôs location and can be discussed in more detail during the interview process. Benefits/additional compensation for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; retirement plans; health benefits; and wellness stipends.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:

Our client who oversees the Client Data & Process Re-engineering group in Capital Markets is currently looking for 4 Jr Analysts to join a new team he's building on a one year contract. The team is responsible for Client Outreach, specifically tied to Dodd Frank (CFTC & SEC) including Protocol 1 & 2 and Canadian Rep Letter #1. The purpose of the outreach is to ensure they get signed documentation from their clients tied to this regulation in a timely manner.




On a daily basis, the candidates would be responsible for:

- Managing their inbox

- Use Markit to confirm regulatory data matches

- Performing data entry into RCS for bilateral documents received

- Coordinating and collaborating with Regulatory Operations, Legal, Compliance, and CMS

- Performing searches and investigations on entities using internal source systems such as CDR, Salesforce, TRACS, RVS, ECIF, FMS and CORA

- Cross-train with Corporate Banking Credit team to understand credit processes and systems

- Cross-train with Legal to understand how to validate Dodd Frank (DF) documents and Data

- Engaging Corporate Banking Credit team and Sales Desk for sales coverage and client contact information




Top 3 Must-Have's:

- Data Entry experience

- Capital Markets or Corporate Banking experience

- Proficiency with MS Excel (intermediate), Outlook and MS Word




In-Office Policy:

- During the first few weeks, this role will be 100% in-office during training and onboarding

- After onboarding period is complete, it will be in-office 3 days per week at their Commerce Court location




Full-Time Opportunities:

- There is potential for these roles to turn into full-time positions at the end of the one year contract, pending budget, performance, and head count allocation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
3 months contract only with opportunity for extension

Summary:

The DSM Tracking & Reporting Analyst is responsible for validating all DSM projects, savings costs and incentives. This position helps account for DSM results, authenticate and process customer incentive payments.

Specific Accountabilities:

Support DSM Evaluation Process by validating customer participation, including calculation of m3 savings, and customer/service provider incentive payments. Utilize various resources to validate equipment and customer eligibility (i.e. manufacturer websites, Google, Google maps, internal financial and CRM applications etc.).
Process DSM projects in CRM and prepare Accounts Payable (A/P) batches by validating vendor information and customer incentive payments. Manage return cheque and replacement cheque process between Customers, Account Managers and A/P.
Resolve customer & service provider inquiries and complaints for outstanding claims.
Liaison with internal and external stakeholders for resolving outstanding issues, discrepancies with project submissions and minimizing DNQ‚Äôs (Do not qualify) in order to maximize shareholder incentive.
Maximize the tracking and reporting functionalities of T&R system of record to readily provide assistance to internal users and assist in enhancements and business requests.
Assist in maintaining up-to-date Tracking & Reporting related process documentation.

Scope/Dimensions:

Processes: Ensure processes are followed and updated to meet Evaluation requirements.
Communication: Provide excellent customer service to internal stakeholders and support external communication to the customer.

Contact / Working Relationships:

Internal: Energy Solutions Advisors, Business Intelligence, DSM Business Solutions, Customer Care, Accounts Payable
External: Third parties that may partner or collaborate with the applicable conservation programs (i.e. Service Organizations, Energy Advisors, etc.)

Required:

Strong analytical skills and the ability to provide suggestions on process improvement.
Post-secondary education in business or a related quantitative discipline or equivalent work experience
Proficiency in MS Office; in particular strong Excel skills needed (proficiency in basic formulas and pivot tables)
Strong overall computer skills and ability to work on CRM related platforms, understand data structure and be able to query data for reporting
Strong interpersonal skills including the ability to work in a cross-functional environment
Detail oriented with proven ability to manage multiple processes, handle competing priorities and while ensuring deadlines are met
Proven ability to work collaboratively with others in a strong team environment
Demonstrates initiative, self-confidence and a strong work ethic

Preferred:

1-3 years of proven analytical work experience
Practical background knowledge in energy conservation program delivery

Working Conditions:

This position requires light physical effort.
The position has a potential for light travel (minimal)
This position requires normal visual / sensory effort.
This position typically operates in an office work environment
