Title: Data Analyst / Modeler Advisory
Description:
Requisition ID: 201119

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Data Analyst Advisory

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team.

Is this role right for you? In this role you will:


Work with business users to obtain data requirements and analyze source systems data.
Design and develop conceptual, logical and physical data models for the operational and analytical databases
Work closely with the technical and application architects, and developers to implement the solution architecture
Communicate physical database designs to, and work with, database administrator to implement databases
Document data flows, identify appropriate data sources, entities, relationships and redundancies
Manage data integrity and data quality.
Maintain technical & business metadata. Generate metadata for Hadoop ingestion for different frameworks.
Design data structures and document data meanings, definitions and intended use, work with various departments/leaders and data stewards to make the ‚Äúmetadata‚Äù available
Define and document the data architecture for operational databases, reporting and provisioning platforms, including the physical components and their functionality
Support data strategies, standards, guidelines data quality process and governance across the enterprise
Provide leadership in researching and architecting emerging technology solutions to meet business objectives


Skills

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We'd love to work with you if you have:


Relational and dimensional data modeling and database design, Erwin (Data modeling) skills.
Strong SQL and and Hive (Hadoop) experience.
Knowledge of data architectural approaches, patterns and emerging technologies (RDBMS, Hadoop and Cloud)
Ability to translate business needs into technical solutions. Strong Analytical skills.
Experience creating architecture and strategy artifacts
Experience of XML, JSON, Copybook, CSV files ingestion
Experience working in Agile environment
Domain Knowledge in financial Services and enterprise functions
Knowledge of database administration, database performance tuning, source & target data structures, ETL processes & products
Knowledge of Data Governance process for metadata and lineage management


What's in it for you?


Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Allyship - We strive to create an inclusive culture where every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are, and are embraced through bias-free practices and inclusive values across Scotiabank. We embrace diversity and provide opportunities for all employee to learn, grow & participate through our various Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) that span across diverse gender identities, ethnicity, race, age, ability & veterans.
Accessibility and Workplace Accommodations - We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Scotiabank continues to locate, remove and prevent barriers so that we can build a diverse and inclusive environment while meeting accessibility requirements.
Upskilling through online courses, cross-functional development opportunities, and tuition assistance.
Competitive Rewards program including bonus, flexible vacation, personal, sick days and benefits will start on day one.
Community Engagement - no matter where you choose to work from; we offer opportunities for community engagement & belonging with our various programs such as hackathons, contests, cooking with friends, Humans of Digital and much more!


Work arrangements: Hybrid

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do

As Senior Analyst, you will:


Contribute to the development audience selection, measurement, and test design, leveraging your expertise to optimize experiment effectiveness.
Analyze experiment performance on an ongoing and ad-hoc basis, evaluating the success of experiments, extracting valuable insights, and providing actionable recommendations for future experiments.
Ensure that generated insights meet rigorous analytical and statistical standards, identifying any gaps or areas for improvement when necessary.
Explore and analyze data from multiple databases and resources, utilizing your analytical skills to uncover meaningful patterns and trends.
Generate ad-hoc analysis based on member data and transactional behavior, empowering the development of new or refined experiment hypotheses.
Actively participate in discussions and provide valuable insights during the development of marketing collateral, leveraging data analysis to contribute to effective messaging and design choices.
Collaborate effectively with various teams within the organization, as well as within our own team, serving as a trusted subject matter expert in analytics and fostering strong collaboration to drive impactful results.
Drive change and foster innovation across all areas supported by analytics, championing new ideas and approaches.


What You Bring


4+ years of experience working in a previous analytics environment.
University degree in Math, Science, Economics, or related fields.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Proven ability to translate business needs into program/technical requirements.
Understanding of loyalty and/or retail industries.
In-depth experience with Python and/or SQL.
Experience working with Big Data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Hive, Spark).
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and industry-standard data warehousing technologies (Cloudera, Snowflake, etc.).
Adaptable and flexible with the ability to navigate changing priorities.


Hybrid

We value flexibility. We have adopted a hybrid work model whereby employees use a combination of working in office and virtually in service of outcomes. Each leader is empowered to decide what work is best achieved in person based on the unique needs of their team.

About Us

Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (‚ÄúCTC‚Äù) is one of Canada‚Äôs most admired and trusted companies. With more than 90 Owned Brands, 1,700 retail locations, financial services, exemplary e-commerce capabilities, and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies. We dream big and work as one to innovate with purpose for our customers at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on top talent to drive the company forward. We offer competitive salaries and wages to CTC employees, as well as store discounts, supported learning through our Triangle Learning Academy, Canadian Tire Profit Sharing, and retirement and savings programs for eligible employees. As part of our enhanced flex benefits program, we offer mental health benefits in the amount of $5,000 per year for benefits-eligible employees and their families, including total well-being, and mental health tools and resources for all employees. Join us in helping to make life in Canada better through living and working our Core Values: we are innovators and entrepreneurs at our core, outcomes drive us, inclusion is a must, we are stronger together and we take personal responsibility. It is an especially exciting time to join CTC and its family of companies where career opportunities are wide-ranging! Join us, where there's a place for you here.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging

We are committed to fostering an environment where belonging thrives, and diversity, inclusion and equity are infused into everything we do. We believe in building an organizational culture where people are consistently treated with dignity while respecting individual religion, nationality, gender, race, age, perceived ability, spoken language, sexual orientation, and identification. We are united in our purpose of being here to help make life in Canada better.

Accommodations

We stand firm in our Core Value that inclusion is a must. We welcome and encourage candidates from equity-seeking groups such as people who identify as racialized, Indigenous, 2SLGBTQIA+, women, people with disabilities, and beyond. Should you require any accommodation in applying for this role, or throughout the interview process, please make them known when contacted and we will work with you to help meet your needs.

Title: ANALYST, DATA & ANALYTICS DIGITAL TRANSFORMATION
Description:
At Allstate, great things happen when our people work together to protect families and their belongings from life‚Äôs uncertainties. And for more than 90 years our innovative drive has kept us a step ahead of our customers‚Äô evolving needs. From advocating for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws, to being an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, and, more recently, device and identity protection.

Job Description

Business Analytics Consultants (BACs) use a mix of business consulting, technical, and solution implementation skills to help Allstate maximize (and

Who is Allstate:

Allstate Insurance Company of Canada is a leading home and auto insurer focused on providing its customers prevention and protection products and services for every stage of life. The company is proud to have been named a Best Employer in Canada for nine consecutive years and prioritizes supporting employees and fostering an inclusive, welcoming corporate culture. Allstate is committed to making a positive difference in the communities in which it operates through partnerships with charitable organizations, employee giving and volunteerism. Serving Canadians since 1953, Allstate strives to provide reassurance with its "You‚Äôre in Good Hands¬Æ" promise.

Through our Employee Value Proposition, Opportunity, Flexibility, Community, Diversity and Family, we have worked hard to develop and nurture a culture where employees feel valued, experience personal growth, have career options and truly enjoy the work they do.

Role Designation: Hybrid

Benefits To Joining Allstate


Flexible Work Arrangements
Employee discounts (15% on auto and property insurance, plus many other products and services)
Good Office program (receive up to 400$ back after purchasing office equipment)
Student Loan Payment Matching Program for Government Student loans
Comprehensive Retirement Savings Program with employer matched contributions
Annual Wellness allowance to support employees with improving health and wellbeing
Personal reflection day
Tuition Reimbursement
Working within the community and giving back!


Job description:

Allstate Canada Group is currently going through an important transformation of its Data environment with the implementation of a new Policy, Claims and Billing systems. We are growing our team and are

actively looking to hire an Analyst, Data & Analytics Digital Transformation to join our team!

Reporting to the Manager, Data & Analytics Digital Transformation, you will be providing key technical expertise to acquire, investigate, manipulate and analyze data to support Allstate Canada Group‚Äôs business plans and results. The candidate will require an in-depth understanding of the data structure and environment and understand the implications from the day-to-day insurance business. The candidate will also be asked to foster efficiency, bring forward creative solutions and create awareness around potential benefits for other initiatives and units. The candidate will be expected to be proactive in developing a network of key collaborators and to be willing to think outside of the box and push the projects a step further.

Accountabilities:


Interpret the data from the user interface of the different source systems and master how it translates into the backend database
Build strong relationships with Claims, Policy and Finance teams to enable their needs in operational reporting, analytics, BI and predictive modeling
Help design and provide requirements for new or improved analytics and reporting
Monitor and ensure data quality of the curated data sets using proper reconciliation methods
Be heavily involved in testing of newly integrated data sources and/or environments
Develop and improve SAS/SQL programs to perform various complex analysis.
Analyze change requests in the source systems or projects, assess their impact on existing data layers
Collaborate with DBAs, other IT teams, Architecture as required
Implement internal data process improvement: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, redesign/restructure database for more efficiency
Develop expertise and aim to become a subject matter expert on the entire data and analytics ecosystem


Qualifications:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree (Actuarial Sciences/Computer Science/Engineering/Math/Stats/Finance or similar) preferred
1-3 years' experience in analytics or similar fields
Strong business acumen
Ability to articulate ideas in both technical and business friendly language
The candidate must be proactive, curious and comfortable working with new data models
Experience with analytics platforms and methodologies (data lake, data warehouse, data marts, ETL, data modelling, data governance, etc.)
Experience in SAS/SQL programming for developing data, cleansing, performing data validation, required data integrity checks, auditing data and improve efficiency of programs
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, VBA, and PowerPoint
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills; verbal and written communication skills; interpersonal and negotiation skills


Bonus qualifications:


Strong knowledge of Tableau and/or other visual analytics tools is preferred
Experience with insurance/actuarial data will be considered a plus


Allstate Canada Group has policies and practices that provide workplace accommodations. If you require accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Skills

Actuarial Science, Communication, Data Governance, Data Lake, Data Mart, Data Modeling, Data Strategies, Data Warehousing (DW), Extract Transform Load (ETL), Insurance Industry, Microsoft Power BI, SQL Coding, Stakeholder Management, Statistical Analysis Systems (SAS) Programming, Tableau (Software)

Joining our team isn‚Äôt just a job ‚Äî it‚Äôs an opportunity. One that takes your skills and pushes them to the next level. One that encourages you to challenge the status quo. And one where you can impact the future for the greater good.

You‚Äôll do all this in a flexible environment that embraces connection and belonging. And with the recognition of several inclusivity and diversity awards, we‚Äôve proven that Allstate empowers everyone to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live.

Good Hands. Greater Together.¬Æ

Through our Employee Value Proposition, Opportunity, Flexibility, Community, Diversity and Family, we have worked hard to develop and nurture a culture where employees feel valued, experience personal growth, have career options and truly enjoy the work they do.

Role Designation: Hybrid

Benefits To Joining Allstate

  • Flexible Work Arrangements
  • Employee discounts (15% on auto and property insurance, plus many other products and services)
  • Good Office program (receive up to 400$ back after purchasing office equipment)
  • Student Loan Payment Matching Program for Government Student loans
  • Comprehensive Retirement Savings Program with employer matched contributions
  • Annual Wellness allowance to support employees with improving health and wellbeing
  • Personal reflection day
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Working within the community and giving back!

Job description:

Allstate Canada Group is currently going through an important transformation of its Data environment with the implementation of a new Policy, Claims and Billing systems. We are growing our team and are

actively looking to hire an Analyst, Data & Analytics Digital Transformation to join our team!

Reporting to the Manager, Data & Analytics Digital Transformation, you will be providing key technical expertise to acquire, investigate, manipulate and analyze data to support Allstate Canada Group‚Äôs business plans and results. The candidate will require an in-depth understanding of the data structure and environment and understand the implications from the day-to-day insurance business. The candidate will also be asked to foster efficiency, bring forward creative solutions and create awareness around potential benefits for other initiatives and units. The candidate will be expected to be proactive in developing a network of key collaborators and to be willing to think outside of the box and push the projects a step further.

Accountabilities:

  • Interpret the data from the user interface of the different source systems and master how it translates into the backend database
  • Build strong relationships with Claims, Policy and Finance teams to enable their needs in operational reporting, analytics, BI and predictive modeling
  • Help design and provide requirements for new or improved analytics and reporting
  • Monitor and ensure data quality of the curated data sets using proper reconciliation methods
  • Be heavily involved in testing of newly integrated data sources and/or environments
  • Develop and improve SAS/SQL programs to perform various complex analysis.
  • Analyze change requests in the source systems or projects, assess their impact on existing data layers
  • Collaborate with DBAs, other IT teams, Architecture as required
  • Implement internal data process improvement: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, redesign/restructure database for more efficiency
  • Develop expertise and aim to become a subject matter expert on the entire data and analytics ecosystem

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree (Actuarial Sciences/Computer Science/Engineering/Math/Stats/Finance or similar) preferred
  • 1-3 years' experience in analytics or similar fields
  • Strong business acumen
  • Ability to articulate ideas in both technical and business friendly language
  • The candidate must be proactive, curious and comfortable working with new data models
  • Experience with analytics platforms and methodologies (data lake, data warehouse, data marts, ETL, data modelling, data governance, etc.)
  • Experience in SAS/SQL programming for developing data, cleansing, performing data validation, required data integrity checks, auditing data and improve efficiency of programs
  • Proficient in MS Word, Excel, VBA, and PowerPoint
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills; verbal and written communication skills; interpersonal and negotiation skills

Bonus qualifications:

  • Strong knowledge of Tableau and/or other visual analytics tools is preferred
  • Experience with insurance/actuarial data will be considered a plus

Allstate Canada Group has policies and practices that provide workplace accommodations. If you require accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Skills

Actuarial Science, Communication, Data Governance, Data Lake, Data Mart, Data Modeling, Data Strategies, Data Warehousing (DW), Extract Transform Load (ETL), Insurance Industry, Microsoft Power BI, SQL Coding, Stakeholder Management, Statistical Analysis Systems (SAS) Programming, Tableau (Software)

Joining our team isn‚Äôt just a job ‚Äî it‚Äôs an opportunity. One that takes your skills and pushes them to the next level. One that encourages you to challenge the status quo. And one where you can impact the future for the greater good.

You‚Äôll do all this in a flexible environment that embraces connection and belonging. And with the recognition of several inclusivity and diversity awards, we‚Äôve proven that Allstate empowers everyone to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live.

Good Hands. Greater Together.¬Æ

Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
Analyze current data processes and make recommendations for improvement based on industry trends and professional business knowledge
Work directly with team to understand analysis and design needs
Use a variety of data analysis and organization tools to discover the most impactful
Implement data products curated by our Chief Data Office, as well as custom data models for fit for use.
Ensure data quality and integrity across various data sources and systems to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and reliability.
Optimize data pipelines for performance and scalability.
Provide technical support to promptly resolve escalated incidents/outages.
Develop and document a detailed solution design, impart your subject matter expertise throughout life cycle.
Develop system performance and development standards requirements, then develop functional, technical and designs.
Build design leverages existing reusable components, traces back to business requirements, and that new modules are designed with reusability in mind.
Keep up to date with the latest industry trends and technologies related to data engineering.



Required


10+ years of relevant experience as BA.
Must be an experienced user with relational SQL and NoSQL databases.



Desired


Experience with Java, Spring,
Experience with big data tools Hadoop, HDFS, ADLS, ADF, Spark, Kafka, Databricks,
Experience in Python
Knowledge of Capital Markets.



Education


Undergraduate Degree.



GalaxE is a professional IT services firm that specializes in platform-driven solutions and the use of automation to achieve enterprise business transformation and mission-critical change for some of the largest companies in the world. Using our proprietary solution set, GxFource¬Æ, we apply machine learning techniques and predictive analytics tools as part of a broad artificial intelligence strategy that provides effective impact and data-driven business transformation.

Since its founding, GalaxE has been dedicated to advancing the benefits of technology. As we continue that legacy and look to the future, a focus on business enablement through agile, cost-efficient, and effective integration of people, process, and technology anchors our success. We revolutionize change in the costs of doing business that transform companies and their ability to leap beyond the competition.

At GalaxE we value people and are committed to diversity and inclusion where our employees are made to feel comfortable and are encouraged to be authentic. We focus on cultivating both traditional IT and non-traditional, new collar, workers through our Outsource to America¬Æ, program.

We are always looking for passionate, entrepreneurial-minded innovators and disrupters; game-changers that take ownership of the work they produce and bring it each and every day. Working with like-minded team members you will get a chance to discover, develop, and use cutting-edge technologies to transform the way we deliver creative business solutions.

Sound like you? Join us and find out for yourself what it means for you, and your career, to be part of the GalaxE team. Let‚Äôs build something, together. #WeAreGalaxE


Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled
Pay is based on several factors including market location and may vary depending on actual job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.



Physical Requirements


Prolonged periods of remaining stationary at a desk and working on a computer
Must be able to lift to 15 lbs., as needed
Must be able to work on-site (corporate/client offices), as needed (not applicable for 100% remote roles)
Occasionally required to bend, kneel, crouch, and reach overhead.
Hand-eye coordination necessary to operate computers and various pieces of office equipment.
Specific vision abilities required include close vision, the ability to tolerate fluorescent lighting, and the ability to adjust focus.



Employees must be able to perform the physical requirements of the position satisfactorily and, if requested, reasonable accommodations will be made to enable employees requiring accommodations to perform the essential functions of their jobs, absent undue hardship.

For more information, please visit https//www.galaxe.com/

Title: Data Analyst, Inventory Technical Operations
Description:
StackAdapt is a self-serve advertising platform that specializes in multi-channel solutions including native, display, video, connected TV, audio, in-game, and digital out-of-home ads. We empower hundreds of digitally-focused companies to deliver outcomes and exceptional campaign performance everyday. StackAdapt was founded with a vision to be more than an advertising platform, it‚Äôs a hub of innovation, imagination and creativity.

StackAdapt‚Äôs Inventory team focuses on developing and leading strategic growth initiatives across our suite of programmatic advertising products within key inventory channels. The Data Analyst of Inventory Technical Operations is a role that operates among the various inventory team functions to drive projects and initiatives. This is a role that requires operational excellence and project management expertise. A successful candidate will have in-depth technical knowledge on programmatic buying, oRTB, and digital ad serving.

StackAdapt is a Remote First company, we are open to candidates located anywhere in North America for this position.

What you'll be doing:


Support inventory technical operations for data analysis, optimization, and automation
Support projects to improve inventory platform features and capabilities
Create technical documentation for procedures and best practices
Develop workflows and monitoring systems to quickly respond to incidents that relate to key inventory KPIs
Support technical initiatives with inventory partners (such as oRTB adoption, pod bidding, tag certification, etc)
Troubleshoot and resolve issues with inventory partners or projects
Ad-hoc campaign troubleshooting, media planning, and investigations as required


What you‚Äôll bring to the table:


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master's degree in a quantitative field, with a proven academic track record. (e.g., finance, economics, statistics, math, etc.)
Outstanding troubleshooting and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail
Strong technical knowledge and writing skills, comfortable presenting to senior stakeholders, internally and externally
Experience with oRTB, programmatic buying, header bidding, ad servers, rich media
Minimum 1-2 years of experience in a technical client-facing role; business development or strategic partner management experience


StackAdapters Enjoy:


Highly competitive salary
RRSP/401K matching
3 weeks vacation + 3 personal care days + 1 Culture & Belief day + birthdays off
Access to a comprehensive mental health care platform
Full benefits from day one of employment
Work-from-home reimbursements
Optional global WeWork membership for those who want a change from their home office
Robust training and onboarding program
Coverage and support of personal development initiatives (conferences, courses, etc)
Access to StackAdapt programmatic courses and certifications to support continuous learning
An awesome parental leave policy
A friendly, welcoming, and supportive culture
Our social and team events!


StackAdapt is a diverse and inclusive team of collaborative, hardworking individuals trying to make a dent in the universe. No matter who you are, where you are from, who you love, follow in faith, disability (or superpower) status, ethnicity, or the gender you identify with (if you‚Äôre comfortable, let us know your pronouns), you are welcome at StackAdapt. If you have any requests or requirements to support you throughout any part of the interview process, please let our Talent team know.

About StackAdapt

We've been recognized for our diverse and supportive workplace, high performing campaigns, award-winning customer service, and innovation. We've been awarded:

Ad Age Best Places to Work 2024

G2 Top Software and Top Marketing and Advertising Product for 2024

Campaign‚Äôs Best Places to Work 2023 for the UK

2024 Best Workplaces for Women and in Canada by Great Place to Work¬Æ

#1 DSP on G2 and leader in a number of categories including Cross-Channel Advertising

Title: Data Engineer Co-op
Description:
Company Description

dynaCERT is a growing energy sector company based in Toronto, ON. We specialize in delivering Carbon Emission Reduction Technologies to a global marketplace. Our reliable and effective electrolysis unit generates hydrogen and oxygen on demand, resulting in reduced emissions and increased fuel economy. Tested and verified by the PIT Group, our HydraGEN‚Ñ¢ Technology has produced significant reductions in fuel consumption, NOx emissions, CO emissions, CO2 emissions, THC emissions, and particulate matter. We are constantly expanding our partnerships with industry leaders, major corporations, private companies, and government bodies to strengthen our presence in various applications, such as rail, marine, oil/gas, mining, and stationary generators.




Role Description

This is a full-time on-site Database Engineer Co-op Internship role at dynaCERT Inc. in Toronto, ON.

The Database Engineer will be responsible for database administration, development, and design tasks.




PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

¬†

Assisting database development teams in designing new database that meet the organization's data storage needs.
Monitoring databases and related systems to ensure optimized performance.
Documenting processes related to database design, configuration, and performance.




TRAINING, EDUCATION & SKILLS REQUIREMENTS




Database Administration, Database Development, and Database Design skills
Data Modeling and Extract Transform Load (ETL) experience
Strong knowledge of SQL and database management systems
Experience with database optimization and performance tuning
Ability to troubleshoot and resolve database issues
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Good communication and collaboration skills
Experience with cloud-based database technologies is a plus¬†

Company Description

dynaCERT is a growing energy sector company based in Toronto, ON. We specialize in delivering Carbon Emission Reduction Technologies to a global marketplace. Our reliable and effective electrolysis unit generates hydrogen and oxygen on demand, resulting in reduced emissions and increased fuel economy. Tested and verified by the PIT Group, our HydraGEN‚Ñ¢ Technology has produced significant reductions in fuel consumption, NOx emissions, CO emissions, CO2 emissions, THC emissions, and particulate matter. We are constantly expanding our partnerships with industry leaders, major corporations, private companies, and government bodies to strengthen our presence in various applications, such as rail, marine, oil/gas, mining, and stationary generators.


Role Description

This is a full-time on-site Database Engineer Co-op Internship role at dynaCERT Inc. in Toronto, ON.

The Database Engineer will be responsible for database administration, development, and design tasks.


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

 

  • Assisting database development teams in designing new database that meet the organization's data storage needs.
  • Monitoring databases and related systems to ensure optimized performance.
  • Documenting processes related to database design, configuration, and performance.


TRAINING, EDUCATION & SKILLS REQUIREMENTS


  • Database Administration, Database Development, and Database Design skills
  • Data Modeling and Extract Transform Load (ETL) experience
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and database management systems
  • Experience with database optimization and performance tuning
  • Ability to troubleshoot and resolve database issues
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Good communication and collaboration skills
  • Experience with cloud-based database technologies is a plus

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Toronto, ON - Hybrid (1-2 days per week in the office)

Contract Length: 5-6 Months.

We at Raise are hiring a Senior Data Analyst for one of our top clients. After establishing themselves as an industry leader, they‚Äôre now expanding their team to meet rising demand.

We‚Äôre hiring right now; if you‚Äôre interested, apply below for your chance to join a great place to work.

Responsibilities


Depending on the project phase.
Compiling data requirements documentation for technology partners.
Data profiling/quality assessment.
Data reconciliation between legacy system and target state environment.
Building data pipelines in Google BigQuery. Data aggregation.
Manage team stakeholder requirements and communications (i.e. with Model Owners, Model Operations, and technology and business partners).
Developing Power BI reports.
Participate in daily stand-ups/ status meetings.
Project management activities could be part of the role.


Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills


At least 10 years of previous work experience in a similar role, gathering/ defining business requirements for data projects.
Previous Titles to look at:
Data BI.
Senior Data Analyst.
Data Engineer.
7 years of hands-on experience with Excel, Data Profiling, SQL, Data Modelling.
7 years of Project management experience.
At least 3 years of experience working with Python and Power BI.
2 years of experience working with Google Cloud technologies such as Big Query.

Nice-To-Have Skills


SAS.
Tableau
SharePoint
Data Governance
Experience with Credit Risk Models preferred (best candidate).


Education & Certificates


Masters or BA in Computer Science, Accounting, or related Analytical field.


Looking for meaningful work? We can help!

Raise is an established hiring firm with over 65 years of experience. We believe strongly in making the world a better place through work, which is why we‚Äôre a certified B Corporation and donate 10% of our profits to charity.

We strive to build teams that reflect the diversity of the communities we work in. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, including people from traditionally underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ2SI, veterans, and people with visible/nonvisible disabilities.

We have a dedicated webpage for accommodations where you can learn more about what we offer, and request accommodation: https://raise.jobs/accommodations/

In order to submit candidates for roles, our clients will sometimes require personal information to confirm the identity of applicants and their legal status to work. Raise will never ask you for personal or banking information unless you have been selected for a job. If you are ever unsure about the legitimacy of this or another job posting by Raise (or have any other questions), please contact us at +1 800-567-9675 or hello@raiserecruiting.com

Title: Data Analyst, People Analytics***Analyste de donn√©es, Analytique RH
Description:
IPEX is one of the North American leading providers of advanced plastic piping systems. Our mission is to shape a better tomorrow by connecting people with water and energy.

We currently have an exciting opportunity as a Data Analyst, People Analytics. This role is based in our office in Oakville, Ontario and reports to the Senior Data Analyst, People Analytics.

Do not miss the opportunity to join a diverse group of people-centric professionals, thought leaders and rapid thinkers, entrepreneurs in spirit and status quo-fighters!

Job Summary

The Data Analyst, People Analytics role, will play an integral role in understanding user requirements and delivering solutions that drive strategic decision-making within IPEX. This individual will focus on the development of HR reports and Power BI Dashboards tailored to support business needs. Responsibilities will include extracting, transforming and visualizing HR Data from multiple sources with the intent of producing meaningful insights. You will collaborate with stakeholders to understand their reporting requirements and ensure the accuracy and reliability of the data provided. This role requires great analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to communicate effectively with a diverse range of stakeholders to support strategic decision-making within the HR Function.

Principal Responsibilities

Reports/Dashboard Development:


Collaborate with Stakeholders to gather business requirements and translate them into reports and/or dashboards to meet the needs of either corporate or operational business unit objectives.
Utilize multiple data sources to create insightful visualizations and reports, identifying trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Responsible for creating, analyzing, optimizing, distributing, and automating reports on a scheduled basis or ad hoc as needed.
Responding to requests for People Data; probing to understand the needs, analyzing relevant data, and providing recommendations to support organizational decision making.
Manage the People Analytics intake process, prioritize and develop a structure to efficiently handle the daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly operational reports including creation, distribution, follow up and resolution of any issues.
Troubleshoot BI and reporting business needs and provide solutions for issue resolution.


Process Improvement And Quality Assurance


Implement standard methodologies for analytics and reporting, documenting report purpose, usage, and data sources.
Support Senior Data Analysts in developing tools and processes, including project deliverables and data governance initiatives.
Collaborate with the HRIS team to monitor data quality, recommend solutions for improvement, and ensure compliance with data privacy regulations.
Provide Administrative support such as meeting minutes, organizing, and maintaining digital documents and internal systems, and other related tasks.


Stakeholder Collaboration, Support, And Training


Collaborate with HR Business Partners and other functional teams to understand reporting requirements and provide customized solutions.
Lead the charge in testing, User Acceptance Testing (UAT), and the rollout of new solutions.
Enable self-service capabilities for standard reports and provides end-user training for dashboards and reports.
Gather feedback from stakeholders to continuously improve reporting processes and ensure alignment with organizational goals.


Qualifications & Experience


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Human Resources, Statistics, Business, Information Technology or another quantitative field.
CHRP Designation would be an asset.
Minimum 3 years‚Äô experience working in HR Analytics and generating reports.
Advanced computer skills and proven experience with business intelligence tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Strong Technical skills in SQL, DAX, or other languages for data mining, manipulation and modeling.
Understanding of HR business processes in areas such as Recruitment, Retention, Performance Management, Training & Development, etc.
Experience working with Workday Day or other Human Resource Management Systems required.
Collaborative team player with effective communication and facilitation skills
Key proficiencies include superb interpersonal skills, ability to handle sensitive/confidential information, data analysis, business acumen, relationship management, HR expertise, HRIS, and cultural awareness.
Experience in a fast-paced environment, managing conflicting priorities, and has high level of adaptability/flexibility.
Bilingualism in French and English is an asset.


IPEX is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities throughout the recruitment process and, upon request, will work with qualified job applicants to provide suitable accommodation in a manner that takes into account the applicant‚Äôs accessibility needs due to disability. Accommodation requests are available to candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process for IPEX jobs. To request an accommodation, please contact HR at HR@ipexna.com

Do not miss the opportunity to join a diverse group of people-centric professionals, thought leaders and rapid thinkers, entrepreneurs in spirit and status quo-fighters!

Job Summary

The Data Analyst, People Analytics role, will play an integral role in understanding user requirements and delivering solutions that drive strategic decision-making within IPEX. This individual will focus on the development of HR reports and Power BI Dashboards tailored to support business needs. Responsibilities will include extracting, transforming and visualizing HR Data from multiple sources with the intent of producing meaningful insights. You will collaborate with stakeholders to understand their reporting requirements and ensure the accuracy and reliability of the data provided. This role requires great analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to communicate effectively with a diverse range of stakeholders to support strategic decision-making within the HR Function.

Principal Responsibilities

Reports/Dashboard Development:

  • Collaborate with Stakeholders to gather business requirements and translate them into reports and/or dashboards to meet the needs of either corporate or operational business unit objectives.
  • Utilize multiple data sources to create insightful visualizations and reports, identifying trends, patterns, and anomalies.
  • Responsible for creating, analyzing, optimizing, distributing, and automating reports on a scheduled basis or ad hoc as needed.
  • Responding to requests for People Data; probing to understand the needs, analyzing relevant data, and providing recommendations to support organizational decision making.
  • Manage the People Analytics intake process, prioritize and develop a structure to efficiently handle the daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly operational reports including creation, distribution, follow up and resolution of any issues.
  • Troubleshoot BI and reporting business needs and provide solutions for issue resolution.

Process Improvement And Quality Assurance

  • Implement standard methodologies for analytics and reporting, documenting report purpose, usage, and data sources.
  • Support Senior Data Analysts in developing tools and processes, including project deliverables and data governance initiatives.
  • Collaborate with the HRIS team to monitor data quality, recommend solutions for improvement, and ensure compliance with data privacy regulations.
  • Provide Administrative support such as meeting minutes, organizing, and maintaining digital documents and internal systems, and other related tasks.

Stakeholder Collaboration, Support, And Training

  • Collaborate with HR Business Partners and other functional teams to understand reporting requirements and provide customized solutions.
  • Lead the charge in testing, User Acceptance Testing (UAT), and the rollout of new solutions.
  • Enable self-service capabilities for standard reports and provides end-user training for dashboards and reports.
  • Gather feedback from stakeholders to continuously improve reporting processes and ensure alignment with organizational goals.

Qualifications & Experience

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Human Resources, Statistics, Business, Information Technology or another quantitative field.
  • CHRP Designation would be an asset.
  • Minimum 3 years‚Äô experience working in HR Analytics and generating reports.
  • Advanced computer skills and proven experience with business intelligence tools such as Power BI or Tableau
  • Strong Technical skills in SQL, DAX, or other languages for data mining, manipulation and modeling.
  • Understanding of HR business processes in areas such as Recruitment, Retention, Performance Management, Training & Development, etc.
  • Experience working with Workday Day or other Human Resource Management Systems required.
  • Collaborative team player with effective communication and facilitation skills
  • Key proficiencies include superb interpersonal skills, ability to handle sensitive/confidential information, data analysis, business acumen, relationship management, HR expertise, HRIS, and cultural awareness.
  • Experience in a fast-paced environment, managing conflicting priorities, and has high level of adaptability/flexibility.
  • Bilingualism in French and English is an asset.

IPEX is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities throughout the recruitment process and, upon request, will work with qualified job applicants to provide suitable accommodation in a manner that takes into account the applicant‚Äôs accessibility needs due to disability. Accommodation requests are available to candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process for IPEX jobs. To request an accommodation, please contact HR at HR@ipexna.com

Works in conjunction with other PBI developers, business analysts and Data Analysts to implement complex data requirements
Maintain DevOps pipelines and deployments


Experience And Skill Set Requirements


Create PBI reports for complex business requirements with features such as drill-through, filtering, and highlighting. Provide specialized skills for developing data access queries and analyses.
Works in conjunction with other PBI developers, business analysts and Data Analysts to implement complex data requirements
Maintain DevOps pipelines and deployments


General Skills


Experience building, testing and implementing complex reports, dashboards, and other objects-25%
Experience providing technical guidance and subject matter expertise on report implementation-25%
Analyse, design, execute, and validate complex BI requirements from multiple business teams
Strategize BI solutions to achieve functional and technical objectives
Prototyping to develop business requirements for future implementation
Proficiency in Data Analysis (DAX), M, ETL (Power Query), SQL (or data extraction and integration tools) and performance optimization-20%

Title: Sr. Analyst, Meter Data
Description:
Wyse Meter Solutions Inc. provides turnkey submetering and utility expense management services to property managers, building owners and developers across Canada. Wyse is unique in its ability to provide energy consumption transparency and accountability to its customers.

The Sr. Analyst, Meter Data is responsible for key aspects of meter data management, including setup, system installation, and data analysis. This role involves data collection, monitoring, troubleshooting, and translating findings into actionable business recommendations. The Sr. Analyst will collaborate with stakeholders to ensure accurate data transmission, billing information, and regulatory compliance. Additionally, this role includes managing and leading meter data management projects and teams.

Key Responsibilities


Lead and Manage MDM (Meter Data Management) projects and process improvement initiatives.
Provide leadership and guidance to project teams and peer analysts to foster collaboration, promote knowledge sharing and continuous improvement.
Operate and maintain the performance of the various meter data collection and data management systems.
Maintain the operation of settlement processes including acquisition and validation, editing, and estimating of interval data.
Troubleshoot and resolve data acquisition issues with the wireless network using network specific software.
Load validation and ensure the data management system is collecting accurate and complete reading data.
Maintain and monitor meter data management system and initiates appropriate action to achieve desired system performance.
Analyze load profile interval data, Time-Of-Use framing and ensure the energy consumption is accurate.
Support Customer Service through the provision of interval data via web presentment, file transfer or direct customer contact.
Assist with the registration, commissioning, auditing, and performance testing of meter installations.
Assess and diagnose meters and meter installations for problems that may affect billing integrity.
Provide direction and guidance to the Certified Meter Mechanic/Testers during field operations to solve technical issues.
Assist in the design, evaluation, commissioning, and maintenance of metering equipment.
Liaise, consult and co-ordinate with internal and external parties, for the installation, analysis, and communication of suite meters.
Resolve critical data management production problems, work with information technology and vendors to implement approved corrections or improvements to systems including software upgrades and all of the user and performance testing to approve for production.
Develop, maintain, update and complete reports, work procedures, records and documentation related to the position, as necessary.
Perform other relevant duties as assigned.


Qualifications


3 ‚Äì 5 years of work experience, ideally in the sub-metering industry or adjacent segment.
University degree or college diploma in engineering, data science, or related field.
Knowledge of Submetering Industry, Meter Data Management system, VEE, and Market Rules would be an asset.
Knowledge of utility billing practices, OEB and Measurement Canada regulations.
Understanding of Advanced Metering Infrastructure technology, Headend System, and Automated Meter Reading.
Demonstrated advanced ability in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel.
Understanding of telecommunications, Wireless 4G LTE, wireless mesh networks and various data communication protocols.


Benefits of Working at Wyse


Be part of a company that is certified as a Great Place to Work
Give back to the community through our Wyse Helping Homes Program
Open yourself to amazing opportunities for career and professional development
Participate in our RRSP program
Enjoy our employee perks in retail, travel, restaurants and many more
We offer an Employee Assistance Program
Join us in our quarterly employee social events
Be part of a collaborative environment
Free parking
TTC accessible


Wyse welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

While we value diversity and welcome applications from qualified candidates, please understand that we cannot provide assistance with LMIA-related matters.

Title: Senior Analyst, Enterprise Analytics
Description:
Job Description

Zendesk is a service-first CRM company that builds powerful, customizable software designed to improve customer relationships. At Zendesk we encourage growth, innovation and believe in giving back to the communities we call home. We are seeking a Senior Analyst, Enterprise Analytics within our Enterprise Data and Analytics team.

We are looking for someone who has the technical skills to surface insights quickly, and the data storytelling skills to communicate those insights in a way that persuades action. You will be responsible for supporting leaders in various functions (Product, GTM, Finance, etc), democratizing data & insights, and conducting in-depth analysis to support data driven decisions. You should be confident in your ability to analyze data from various sources and to communicate a strategic narrative based on your analysis of the data. This role is both technical and analytical.

Responsibilities Include


Collaboration with business partners in Product, Finance, Marketing, and GTM to identify and prioritize research and analysis efforts
Define problem statements and explore the data to understand who our customers are, how they get value out of Zendesk products, and where we can develop our products to improve retention and create even greater value over time
Build business insights, reports and dashboards that will lead to better business decisions, product development prioritization and higher team productivity in a way that promotes a data-driven mindset for the Product organization
Partner with in function data & analytics team and cross-functional analytics teams to drive standardization and consistency of product insights reporting across the entire company
Build the visualizations that display the data-driven insights in a beautifully simple way
Participate in cross-functional teams as a domain data expert
Mentor and enable team members and other users of the data


Desired Skills And Qualifications


An analytical mindset, with the intellectual curiosity to search for context and insight behind the numbers paired with a strong business and product acumen
4+ years experience working with SQL or other querying language; be ready to demonstrate this skill in your interview (required)
Proficiency with analytics and visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, or similar. Ability to turn data into actionable insights and visually engaging reports. (preferred)
Demonstrate an ability to deliver work autonomously while developing domain expertise and enabling your peers
Excellent problem-solving skills to understand data analysis needs and devise suitable strategies.
A knack for identifying and investigating anomalies in data and ability to analyze complex dataset and draw meaningful insights
Applied experience in framing ambiguous problems, collecting/preparing data, and applying analytical rigor
Exceptional communication and presentation skills. Able to tell a visual story that leads to results and decision making


Zendesk software was built to bring a sense of calm to the chaotic world of customer service. Today we power billions of conversations with brands you know and love.

Zendesk believes in offering our people a fulfilling and inclusive experience. Our hybrid way of working, enables us to purposefully come together in person, at one of our many Zendesk offices around the world, to connect, collaborate and learn whilst also giving our people the flexibility to work remotely for part of the week.

Hybrid: In this role, our hybrid experience is designed at the team level to give you a rich onsite experience packed with connection, collaboration, learning, and celebration - while also giving you flexibility to work remotely for part of the week. This role must attend our local office for part of the week. The specific in-office schedule is to be determined by the hiring manager.

The Intelligent Heart Of Customer Experience

Zendesk software was built to bring a sense of calm to the chaotic world of customer service. Today we power billions of conversations with brands you know and love. We advocate for digital first customer experiences‚Äîand we stick with it in our workplace. Over 5,000 employees worldwide are collaborating from kitchen tables, home offices, coworking spaces, and Zendesk workspaces to make one team.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we‚Äôre proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.

Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to peopleandplaces@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Clutch

We‚Äôre on a mission to reinvent the way people buy, sell, and own cars. Are you game?

Clutch is Canada‚Äôs largest online used car retailer, delivering a seamless, hassle-free car-buying experience to drivers everywhere. Customers can browse hundreds of cars from the comfort of their home, get the right one delivered to their door, and enjoy peace of mind with our 10-Day Money-Back Guarantee‚Ä¶ and that‚Äôs just the beginning.

Named two years in a row to the Globe & Mail‚Äôs list of the Top Growing Companies in Canada and also awarded a spot on LinkedIn‚ÄôsTop Canadian Startups list, we‚Äôre looking to add curious, hard-working, and driven individuals to our growing team.

Headquartered in Toronto, Clutch was founded in 2017 and currently services British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan, Ontario, New Brunswick, Nova Scotia, and Prince Edward Island. Clutch is backed by a number of world-class investors, including Canaan, BrandProject, Real Ventures, D1 Capital, and Upper90. To learn more, visit clutch.ca.

About The Role

Clutch is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Sell-to-Clutch (STC) Team! The STC team is responsible for sourcing Clutch inventory for both retail and wholesale channels. As a Senior Data Analyst at Clutch, you will work alongside product, engineering, pricing, and operations to better understand our products, customers, and business processes. You will help us identify opportunities/insights, and make data-driven recommendations to scale the STC business.

What You‚Äôll Do


Develop metrics and dashboards to focus the team on critical KPIs and help make data-driven decisions
Use data to drive insights into various parts of Clutch‚Äôs business, from funnel conversion to inventory acquisition
Manage pricing models that dictate pricing spread and acquisition volumes across all vehicle segments (Year, Make, Model, Mileage, Price Point, etc.)
Improve analytics quality and efficiency
Become a domain expert in automotive retail
This is a full-time on-site position - you will be splitting your time between our Etobicoke production facility at 223 Evans Avenue and downtown HQ at 60 Adelaide Street East


What We‚Äôre Looking For


At least 2+ years of experience in data, reporting, or analytics.
Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools such as Metabase and Tableau
Strong written and verbal communication skills to influence non-technical audiences with analytical insights
Comfort working on ambiguous problems with large and complex datasets
Self-starter and ability to dig deep into a problem area


It‚Äôd Be Great If You Have


Product analytics experience
Pricing Experience
Providing data strategies and insights at a data-driven tech company
A/B testing


Why You‚Äôll Love It At Clutch


Autonomy & ownership -- create your own path, and own your work
Competitive compensation and equity incentives!
Health & dental benefits


Clutch is committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. If you require accommodation at any stage of the interview process, please email talent@clutch.ca.

Title: Customer Insights Analyst
Description:
Job Requisition ID #

24WD80034

French job description to follow!/La description de poste en fran√ßais se trouve plus bas!

Position Overview

At Autodesk our mission is to deliver an outstanding customer experience. We are looking for a Voice of the Customer Insights Analyst in our quest to uncover insights.

Working within the Customer Insights and Success Experience Team, reporting to the Manager of Customer Insights, you will analyze multiple sources of customer feedback and extract relevant insights to help guide operational improvements and inform strategic decisions.

This is a remote position.

Responsibilities


Analyze customer feedback, quantitative and qualitative, to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for improvement
Create actionable, data-driven report that inform customer experience improvements and strategic decisions
Organize insights in a compelling manner through reports, written summaries, and data visualizations
Leverage text analytics and regression analysis when applicable to provide more comprehensive insights
Deliver compelling presentations to colleagues at all levels including senior leadership
Collaborate with other teams to identify strategies and programs based on customer feedback
Stay up to date on industry trends and best practices in customer experience management and mentor colleagues on best practices


The Ideal Candidate


You have a customer mindset ‚Äì you can easily put yourself in the customer's shoes and represent their point of view back to other team members
You understand the value of collaboration ‚Äì you're able to work with a variety of different team members to create agreement around common goals
You crave creative challenges ‚Äì you see problems as opportunities to solve
You bring data to the debate ‚Äì you love data wrangling and delving into new datasets and understand data-backed set of insights will lead to better recommendations


Minimum Qualifications


1+ years of experience as a Customer Insights Analyst or in a similar role
Transform Voice of Customer data into applicable insights
A bachelor's degree in marketing or market research

Job Requisition ID #

24WD80034

French job description to follow!/La description de poste en fran√ßais se trouve plus bas!

Position Overview

At Autodesk our mission is to deliver an outstanding customer experience. We are looking for a Voice of the Customer Insights Analyst in our quest to uncover insights.

Working within the Customer Insights and Success Experience Team, reporting to the Manager of Customer Insights, you will analyze multiple sources of customer feedback and extract relevant insights to help guide operational improvements and inform strategic decisions.

This is a remote position.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze customer feedback, quantitative and qualitative, to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for improvement
  • Create actionable, data-driven report that inform customer experience improvements and strategic decisions
  • Organize insights in a compelling manner through reports, written summaries, and data visualizations
  • Leverage text analytics and regression analysis when applicable to provide more comprehensive insights
  • Deliver compelling presentations to colleagues at all levels including senior leadership
  • Collaborate with other teams to identify strategies and programs based on customer feedback
  • Stay up to date on industry trends and best practices in customer experience management and mentor colleagues on best practices

The Ideal Candidate

  • You have a customer mindset ‚Äì you can easily put yourself in the customer's shoes and represent their point of view back to other team members
  • You understand the value of collaboration ‚Äì you're able to work with a variety of different team members to create agreement around common goals
  • You crave creative challenges ‚Äì you see problems as opportunities to solve
  • You bring data to the debate ‚Äì you love data wrangling and delving into new datasets and understand data-backed set of insights will lead to better recommendations

Minimum Qualifications

  • 1+ years of experience as a Customer Insights Analyst or in a similar role
  • Transform Voice of Customer data into applicable insights
  • A bachelor's degree in marketing or market research
  • Experience with data analysis tools (i.e. Qualtrics)

Title: BI Reporting Consultant
Description:
We‚Äôre building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what‚Äôs right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You'll Be Doing

You‚Äôll be joining CIBC‚Äôs Finance Technology team within Enterprise Technology. You‚Äôll be at the heart of CIBC‚Äôs digital transformation, building easy to use, flexible, and robust reporting, analytics and planning solutions. You will develop, test and support the implementation of these cross-functional, multi-platform application systems. You‚Äôll lead the planning and strategy for the technical design, development and integration of these applications.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You'll Succeed


Design and development - Perform and coordinate complicated application programming activities. Design the application's technical infrastructure using specific databases, programming languages, utilities, and testing approaches. Lead the design and development of cost-effective and innovative solutions.
Strategic planning - Develop multi-year technology roadmaps that align with the bank‚Äôs vision, strategy, and business goals. Lead multiple complicated projects involving backend systems, new technology, and the enhancement of existing applications.
Leadership skills - Act as a development team lead and run code-review sessions with the wider team to ensure the project is on track to meet objectives.


Who You Are


You can demonstrate experience in: Developing, testing, and implementing business intelligence solutions for a Corporate Finance organization. Candidates will have 5+ years working experience with Oracle RDBMS, Hyperion Essbase/Planning and OAS development. It‚Äôs an asset if you have experience with SAC, SAP S4/HANA, Oracle APEX, Python, Java EE applications and workload automation / job scheduling tools.
You embrace and advocate change. You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
Your influence makes a difference. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by sharing your expertise.
You‚Äôre digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
You're motivated by collective success. You know that teamwork can transform a good idea into a great one. You know that an inclusive team that enjoys working together can bring a vision to life.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.


What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.


We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a benefits program*, defined benefit pension plan*, an employee share purchase plan, a vacation offering, wellbeing support, and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.
Subject to plan and program terms and conditions


What You Need To Know


CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.
We may ask you to complete an attribute-based assessment and other skills tests (such as simulation, coding, French proficiency, MS Office). Our goal for the application process is to get to know more about you, all that you have to offer, and give you the opportunity to learn more about us.


Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 27th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

AutoSys Workload Automation, Azure Storage, Enterprise Technologies, Hyperion Essbase, Job Scheduler, Microsoft Azure, Microsoft Azure Databases Administration, Oracle, Oracle Analytics Cloud, Oracle Application Express (APEX), Oracle Hyperion Data Relationship Management (DRM), Oracle Hyperion EPM, Oracle Hyperion Planning, Oracle WebLogic, Python (Programming Language), SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP BW on HANA, SAP Databases, SAP Development

Title: Implementation Consultant ‚Äì BI/Tableau
Description:
Delbridge Solutions is growing.

Delbridge Solutions is one of North America‚Äôs fastest-growing technology companies. With offices in Canada, USA, Europe, and Costa Rica, we provide world-class software solutions and implementation services for Performance Management, Data Management, Data Privacy, and Corporate Transformation Services. The majority of our clients are Fortune 1000 companies and trust Delbridge Solutions as a partner to support their business processes.

Who you are:

You are an experienced BI/Tableau Implementation Consultant looking to move out of the shadows and into a highly visible role working on exciting platforms. You want an opportunity to grow your technical expertise by learning new technologies. Furthermore, you want to be recognized for your innovation and your insights. As a client-focused, technologically-astute problem solver, you are ready to join a rapidly scaling mid-sized company that is effectively carving out their share of the market. You are ambitious, and you want to join a company that is ready to invest in you the way you invest in them.

You want to:


Be recognized. You want to move up the ranks quickly. You want your achievements to be applauded and appreciated
Be an innovator. You want to bring your ideas to the table and see them implemented
Be a leader. You want to customize smart solutions and work in partnership with our clients. You want to mentor junior team members


What you will be doing as our Senior Implementation Consultant:


Communicate. You will provide regular status updates to the Technical/Project Lead and the client. You will create documentation and participate in project meetings
Drive implementation. You will be a primary resource and consultant through the full lifecycle of the solution. You will:
Gather client business requirements in partnership with the Project Lead
Design an innovative solution using best practices and customizing for the client‚Äôs specific needs
Make the granular design decisions around acquiring and loading data
Be a hands-on SME advising, implementing, testing and training
Collaborate. You will work closely with internal and external contacts to ensure we are delivering a tailored solution meeting client‚Äôs specification
Mentor. You will support and mentor the junior team members
Nurture. You will manage and foster strong client relationships, providing support to project kickoffs and ongoing implementations
Travel. You will reinforce our belief in face-to-face relationship building, travelling up to 20% of the time to client sites across North America


What you will bring to the team and Delbridge Solutions:


Project implementation expertise. You have 2+ years implementing BI/Tableau applications, preferably in a consulting role for some of that time
The technical skills. You have proven hands-on ability to build dimensions, cubes, ETL processes and write complex SQL queries. You are an Excel expert
The personality. You are ambitious, innovative and collaborative. You are consultative by nature
People management skills. You are passionate about mentoring and growing people and teams
The relationship building focus. You have exceptional written and oral communication skills. You are willing and able to travel across Canada and the US to work with our clients
The education. Candidates with university degrees in Computer Science, Accounting or Engineering are preferred but not required


Why Delbridge Solutions:

As Delbridge Solutions grows, our leadership team is focused on:


Fostering a collaborative environment because we believe that everyone here has a valuable contribution to make, that together we can develop a deeper understanding of our position in the market and the needs of our clients
Recognizing our people through quarterly rewards, performance bonuses and accelerated career paths. Whether you want to move up in Professional Services, across to Project Management, or Solution Architect, Delbridge Solutions wants to give you the chance to prove yourself - and we will recognize and rewards your efforts


If you want to join a fast-growing company that pivots based on market demand, Delbridge Solutions would love to start a conversation and learn more about you.

Delbridge Solutions welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

  • Drive implementation. You will be a primary resource and consultant through the full lifecycle of the solution. You will:
    • Gather client business requirements in partnership with the Project Lead
    • Design an innovative solution using best practices and customizing for the client‚Äôs specific needs
    • Make the granular design decisions around acquiring and loading data
    • Be a hands-on SME advising, implementing, testing and training
  • Collaborate. You will work closely with internal and external contacts to ensure we are delivering a tailored solution meeting client‚Äôs specification
  • Mentor. You will support and mentor the junior team members
  • Nurture. You will manage and foster strong client relationships, providing support to project kickoffs and ongoing implementations
  • Travel. You will reinforce our belief in face-to-face relationship building, travelling up to 20% of the time to client sites across North America

What you will bring to the team and Delbridge Solutions:

  • Project implementation expertise. You have 2+ years implementing BI/Tableau applications, preferably in a consulting role for some of that time
  • The technical skills. You have proven hands-on ability to build dimensions, cubes, ETL processes and write complex SQL queries. You are an Excel expert
  • The personality. You are ambitious, innovative and collaborative. You are consultative by nature
  • People management skills. You are passionate about mentoring and growing people and teams
  • The relationship building focus. You have exceptional written and oral communication skills. You are willing and able to travel across Canada and the US to work with our clients
  • The education. Candidates with university degrees in Computer Science, Accounting or Engineering are preferred but not required

Why Delbridge Solutions:

As Delbridge Solutions grows, our leadership team is focused on:

  • Fostering a collaborative environment because we believe that everyone here has a valuable contribution to make, that together we can develop a deeper understanding of our position in the market and the needs of our clients
  • Recognizing our people through quarterly rewards, performance bonuses and accelerated career paths. Whether you want to move up in Professional Services, across to Project Management, or Solution Architect, Delbridge Solutions wants to give you the chance to prove yourself - and we will recognize and rewards your efforts

If you want to join a fast-growing company that pivots based on market demand, Delbridge Solutions would love to start a conversation and learn more about you.

Delbridge Solutions welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
